loans.name: Zebeon's Group

texts.en:
Zebeon, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. He is 48 years old, is married, and has six children.

Zebeon likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Zebeon plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Zebeon’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora ha trabajado en la agricultura y especialmente en la producción de café  desde hace 43 años. Ella está en el proceso de conversión de producción de café convencional a café Orgánico porque está convencida que es rentable y saludable para ella y su familia, para iniciar este proceso pastora necesita dos millones ochocientos mil pesos (2.800.000) con los cuales comprara dos terneros que le servirán para producir los abonos orgánicos que necesita en su finca, también desea sembrar 300 árboles más de café y diversificar sus cultivos con productos que mejoren la alimentación familiar. A nivel personal pastora desea adecuar una vivienda digna y ayudar a sus nietos en el estudio.



La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Pastora ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La Federación Campesina del Cauca está convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Pastora has been working in agriculture, especially coffee growing, for 43 years. She is in the process of converting from the production of conventionally grown coffee to organically grown coffee because she is convinced that it is profitable and healthy for her and her family. To start this process, Pastora needs two million and eight hundred pesos (2,800,000), with which she will buy two calves that will serve her to produce the organic fertilizer she needs on her farm. She also wants to plant 300 more coffee trees and diversify her farming with products that will improve her family's diet. On a personal level, Pastora wishes to have decent housing and help her grandchildren with their education.

The conversion to the production of organically grown coffee is a comprehensive process that, in the long-term, is independent, healthy, balanced, and environmentally friendly. This is a challenge for Colombia's farmers and Pastora has decided to not risk her health, her family's health or the consumers' health by continued use of chemicals. The Farmer's Federation of Cauca is convinced that supporting and strengthening these alternatives is worthwhile. A Kiva loan represents a sustainable future for her production, her land, and her family.

loans.use: to grow organic coffee

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a resourceful, loving man. He knows that he needs to work hard to help his children get ahead with excellent values and education. William is a small dairy and poultry farmer hoping to get his hands on the horticultural market. He has been doing crop farming for subsistence purposes. He also grows vegetables, maize, and grass for his cow. 

William is requesting a loan, which he will use to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. 

William is very excited to start commercialization of his crops. He will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. His increased income will uplift the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a proud 54-year-old father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in the Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, John has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

John described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

With this loan, John’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a proud 43-year-old mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 7 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Gladys has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Gladys described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Gladys’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Enock's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Enock, often described as an extremely friendly person. He is 72 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Enock is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Enock says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has gained a lot of respect in his community, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Enock will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.5 acres. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is a 54-year-old woman, who has a 6-member-family and lives in Sachkhere district. She works hard to do her bit for the family's welfare and is involved in a trading business, where in particular she sells used clothing. Aside from that, she is also an accountant for a private organization. 

However, the entire income that she generates is small - consisting of 300-350 GEL approximately. In order to increase her contribution to the family's welfare and get another source of income, Dali requested a loan from local financial institutions. 

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 700 USD for purchasing tools and equipment for opening a beauty salon locally. 

With the support of the start-up program, Dali will get the chance greatly to increase her productivity and give her family members a better style of life. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase all equipment and tools and open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur is a photographer from Vanadzor town. 

He receives orders from different magazines and individuals and provides a photoshooting service for different ceremonies. Bakur is very talented and also does paintings (in the photo) and wants to prepare an exhibition so he will have a chance to be present in different areas.  

Bakur has now applied for this loan to purchase a car which he needs for his work. Bakur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This talented young man hopes for your support, to pay for a car so as to be able to facilitate his work as a photographer.

loans.use: to pay for a car.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is 47 years old. She is married and she lives at her parents-in-law's house. Jannet is the mother of three children and all of them are going to school.

Jannet works every day selling hygiene products. She has her own store and she needs a loan to buy hygiene products for her business such as tooth brushes and deodorants.

Jannet would like to move to her own house in the future because the house where she and her family are living is very old.

loans.use: to buy hygiene products for her business such as tooth brushes and deodorants.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 36 years old. She is married and has four children aged 2 to 4 years. They do not yet go to school. Her husband is a businessman..

She sells food and she has been in business for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Theogenie

texts.en:
Theogenie is 37 years old. She is married and has four children between 7 and 13 years. They all go to school. Her husband is a businessman.

She sells food and she has been in business for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, beans and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. She wishes to earn at least 300,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stationary to resell in her business.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 43 years old. She is married with six children aged between 1 and 15 years old. Three of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and she has been doing a business for the past 2 years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 53 years old, from the village of Salkhino. She lives with her husband, son and his family members. The family's main source of income is from agricultural activity. Svetlana and her family members are engaged in cattle and pig breeding, in harvesting of nuts seasonally. Svetlana's husband works as a baker and gets a small income. 

The family members have a great desire to open their own bakery and make profitable family business. Svetlana requested a loan from local financial institutions. The Start-Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 5,200 GEL. 

They will build traditional Georgian bakery and will start selling newly baked bread among local people. Svetlana thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a good location and is the only business of this kind in the area. After the bakery is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.  

With the support of the Start-Up program, Svetlana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a traditional Georgian bakery and start selling bread.

loans.name: Frech's Group

texts.en:
Frech is a proud 47-year-old father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 8 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Frech has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Frech described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Frech’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Clauthilde

texts.en:
Clauthilde is 39 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 4 months and 16 years. She is owns a shop and she has been doing this business for the past 2 years. 

Her husband is also a business man. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Las Campeonas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Las Campeonas, el grupo se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, estas son mujeres muy luchadoras que se están uniendo para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos, son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Herenia cuenta con una chipería en su casa, ella es muy activa, a tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta a preparar las chipas de manera muy higiénica. Y después las sale a vender por su barrio de manera ambulante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus chipas, como ser almidón, harina de maíz, queso, huevo y otros. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en: The committee is named "Las Campeonas." The group is in the second cycle, they are courageous women who are uniting to be able to help their families and loved ones. They work very hard and are dedicated. One of the members, Mrs. Herenia, has a chiperia (bakery) in her house. She is very active, and gets up very early to prepare the chipas in a very hygienic manner. Later, she goes out to sell them on the street  in her neighborhood. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to be able to make her chipas (a delicious bread made from tapioca starch, cheese, and other ingredients) such as tapioca starch, corn flour, cheese, eggs and others. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chipa (a delicious bread made from tapioca starch, cheese, and other ingredients) such as tapioca starch, corn flour, cheese, eggs, and others.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is 37 years old. He is married and he pays rent. His wife travels a lot. Angel is father of two children who go to school.

Angel works every day. He is a radio taxi driver. He needs a loan to buy spare parts for his taxi. Angel is the owner of the vehicle, and he would like to be the owner of a house for his family in the future.

He hopes you will trust him because he works hard and he is responsible.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty, se dedica a la distribución de productos fármacos, a las despensas de las comunidades más cercanas de la ciudad.
Comenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace un buen tiempo, y que con ello está saliendo adelante, es una persona muy emprendedora, que poco a poco y con la lucha diaria y pese a los problemas ha podido salir adelante.
Quiere seguir creciendo con su trabajo, es por eso que pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos de farmacias para la venta, y con ello poder surtirse y surtir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in the city of Curuguaty.  He distributes pharmaceutical products to the stores in the communities closest to the city.  He says that he has been doing this work for a good amount of time.  With this he is getting ahead.  He is an very enterprising person.  Little by little, and with the daily struggle, he has been able to get ahead in spite of the problems.

He wants to keep growing in his work.  That is why he is requesting this loan to be able to buy pharmaceutical products to sell.  With this he will be able to stock up and stock his customers.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 34 years old. She is married with one child who is two years old. Her child does not yet go to school. 

She owns a salon and she has been doing this business for the past 8 years. Her husband is a motorcyclist. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment such as chairs, combs and machines to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more equipment such as chairs, combs and machines to sell.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is a 59-year-old woman from the village of Didi Chkoni. She has a daughter and both family members are temporarily unemployed. 

The family owns agricultural land where nuts and persimmons are grown. Eter realizes income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Eter decided to start dairy farming and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of the family's poor living conditions. 

The Start-Up Program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 GEL for purchasing a milk cow. After the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products such as cheese and yogurt for selling. They also will use the milk products for the family.
 
The loan will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her daughter, as they will get the chance to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start dairy farming.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland, a 40-year-old married man, lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. 

He was unable to start any stable job and start his own private activities. Roland works on private orders and renovates flats through the town. He is the only breadwinner, and he works hard to make a financially stable life for his beloved wife. He gets a small income that is hardly enough to satisfy the family's needs, however. 

In order to make an additional source of income and improve his family's living conditions, Roland decided to open a restaurant. He found a place and renovated most of it on his own. Now he needs financial support to finish repairing activities and purchase furniture, such as chairs and tables and open a restaurant. 

Roland and his wife will do their best to make the new business profitable and they are very motivated to have a big list of loyal customers. The financial support from Kiva lenders will be a really great help for Roland, as his income will significantly increase and he will get the chance to make a good living.

loans.use: To finish repairing activities and purchase furniture for his restaurant.

loans.name: Tornike

texts.en:
Tornike is a 24-year-old man from Kutaisi city. He has only his mother, who is a teacher at the local public school in a nearby village. Because of poor living conditions, Tornike was unable to get higher education and for this reason he started work as an operator of a warehouse. 

He has a great desire to improve the living condition of his family and start his own business. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of poor living conditions and lack of experience. 

The Start Up Program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,500 USD. 

Tornike plans to use the requested amount to start a trading business. He will purchase cars abroad and will sell them locally with price mark-ups. The business will be profitable, he thinks, as prices of cars are higher in his country and the demand is also high among people. 

With support of the Start Up Program, Tornike will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties. Tornike and his mother rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To start a car-selling business.

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en:
Josianne is 31 years old. She is married and has four children between 3 and 7 years. Two of them go to school. Her husband is a businessman.

She sells food and she has been in business for the past eight years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, rice and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 43 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 18 y 24 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pedro con el afán de genera sus ingresos y apoyar a su familia con los gastos de la casa, trabaja como  vendedor de agua pura desde hace 10 años.
Ahora él quiere remodelar su humilde casa porque con el paso de los años ha tenido algunos desperfectos, por tal razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar sus materiales como: cal arena cemento, y hierro, porque él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar la remodelación.
Pedro espera contar con el crédito para poder mejorar su casa y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro is 43 years old. He is married, he has a beautiful family with three children between the ages of 18 and 24. This nice family lives in a community in Solola. To generate income and support his family with their household expenses, Pedro has worked as a pure water salesman for the past ten years. He now wants to remodel his humble house because over the years it has had several damages. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy materials, such as limestone, sand, cement, and iron rods because he doesn't have enough funds to do the remodel.  Pedro hopes to obtain the loan to improve his house and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy limestone, sand, cement, and iron rods to remodel his house.

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es:
El  señor Castulo tiene 61 años, vive con su esposa y un hijo ya mayor de edad, es una pareja que siempre ha trabajo y que luchan para poder salir adelante.
El Sr. Castulo comenta que anteriormente trabajada en la agricultura en una de las compañías de Ybycuí, luego pudo juntar un capital y decidió comprar un  terreno  en la ciudad, donde construyó una nueva casa y además pudo comprar un auto en el cual se dedicaba al servicio de fletes, hace unos años en vista a la mucha demanda de los productos panificados decidió dedicarse a la panadería, actualmente ya cuenta con una gran clientela su negocio de panadería.
Pide este préstamo para la construcción de un horno nuevo con el cual podrá hacer sus panes y poder seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Mr. Castulo is 61 years old, he lives with his wife and a son who is of age. His wife and him are a couple that has always worked and fought to get ahead.
Mr. Castulo comments that he used to work in agriculture with one of the Ybycui companies. He was eventually able to gather his capital and decided to buy some land in the city where he built a new house and also bought a car which he uses to provide shipping services. A few years ago, in the light of large demand for bread products he decided to dedicate himself to being a baker. His bakery business already has a great client base. 
He is requesting this loan in order to build a new oven for breadmaking which will allow him to make his breads and continue working hard to improve.

loans.use: build a new oven for breadmaking

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro esta trabajando y estudiando a la vez, se dedica a la venta de prendas brasilera, comenta que por medio de su trabajo se gana el sustento diario para el  para su familia, el es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Pedro is working and studying at the same time, he runs a business selling Brazilian clothes. He mentions that through his business he earns his family's daily livelihood. He is a hard working and determined person who wants to grow and succeed. He is requesting this loan to purchase different garments, this way he will be able to continue his sales like he has been doing.

loans.use: purchase garments for sale

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que esta poniendo todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante, comenta que su anterior préstamo le fue muy útil ya que pudo invertirlo en su emprendimiento y con ello ayudar a su familia.
Comenta que pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y poder comprar verduras, frutas, fideos, arroz, azúcar y demás. Esteban agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en: Esteban is a hard working, entrepreneurial person who is giving his all in order to grow and succeed. He comments that the last loan was very useful for him as he was able to invest it in his entrepreneurial business and consequently help his family. He also comments that he is requesting a new loan to be able to stock his business and be able to purchase vegetables, fruit, noodles, rice, sugar and more. Esteban is grateful for this new opportunity he is receiving and to be able to keep striving to improve.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, fruit, noodles, rice, sugar and more

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTISIMA TRINIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Venecia ella es soltera y tiene 60 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Santisima Trinidad communal bank.  This bank is located in the Huayopata district, La Convención province, Cusco department.

María Venecia, age 60, is a member.  She is single and has one child.  She works in her business of growing fruit.  She has a piece of land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines, and oranges.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has had this business for several years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand the land that she cultivates.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members have businesses selling animals, selling clothes, a grocery store, and selling food.

María Venecia is grateful to those who make up part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Los Artesanos De Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ARTESANOS DE SANTA ANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natalia ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Los Artesanos de Santa Ana communal bank.  This bank is located in the Santa Ana district, La Convención province, Cusco department.

Natalia is a member.  She is 33 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She works in her business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens them, and they grow.  Then, she sells them at the different fairs and markets.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had this business for four years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell the animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

The other members have businesses selling animals, selling clothes, a grocery store, and selling food.

Natalia is grateful to those who make up part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a businesswoman who is married and has a boy and a girl who are still at school. She is in her mid 30s. She has supported her family by running a shop selling shoes, clothes and handbags since 2006. She starts working from 7:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fourth credit request. She will use it to buy stock of shoes, clothes and handbags to resell. She invested the previous credits to her shop by restocking more bags, shoes, blouses and dresses, etc. 

She is really happy with Kiva's loan since her business has gained some extra miles. She used the profit to plow back into her business and covered school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, she would like to open another big shop of the same type. She has paid back successfully the previous loans.

Bertha will hold herself accountable for being responsible to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of shoes, clothes and handbags to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Luz is 50 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Ma. Luz has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of Avon products to sell to her customers.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for eight years. Ma. Luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: A sus 54 años de edad Maria es viuda, tiene  5 hijos, de ellos 3 son hombres y 2  mujeres, Maria vive con 4 hijos en una casa por la que paga arriendo, Maria desde muy joven se dedica  a la crianza animales menores y a la venta de carbon, Maria necesita el dinero del credito para comprar pollos, Maria tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, tambien comenta que una de sus hjas recientemente salio del colegio y no pudo matricularse a la universidad por falta de recursos economicos y que el negocio de  Maria  no le deja los suficientes ingresos  como para pagar estudio superiores que desea su hija, Maria tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio y de ser posible matricular a su hija a la universidad.
texts.en:
At 54 years old, Maria is a widow and a mother of five. She has 3 sons and 2 daughters and lives with four of them in a home she is renting. Since she was young, Maria has been raising small animals as well as selling charcoal. Maria needs money in order to purchase more chickens.

One of Maria's sons is going to school and her daughters recently left school but could not enroll in the university for lack of resources. Maria's business currently does not generate enough income to pay for the university studies that her one daughter dreams of. Maria's aspiration is to improve her business and to be able to enroll her daughter in the university.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. Milagros is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 38 years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagros is 48 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Milagros has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Milagros has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Margaret, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married and has three children. Margaret has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Margaret isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Margaret will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Margaret's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is 71 years old and works sewing clothes. She started eight years ago, and her business has been growing. Her clients are manufacturing companies that outsource part of their production. 

Maria Guadalupe is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine. She says that thanks to her work, she has been able to build her house. Her goal is to keep working and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Francisco Javier is 58 years old and works as a porter. He works one full day and rests the next one. On the days that he rests, he works in a small shop where he manufactures handbags.

He describes himself as a happy person who enjoys working and dancing. He says that he has many clients for his bags. He sells them to people who are in the building where he works as a porter. 

He is asking for a loan to buy materials to manufacture handbags.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce handbags.

loans.name: Las Leonas De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO.
La socia María Carmen alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de  restaurant, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos a la carta entre otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz, menestras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The associate of this loan belongs to the communal bank LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO.

Her name is Maria Carmen and she works in a restaurant where she cooks many different dishes. She has spent years working here and things are going well for her because of the hard work she puts into her job every day. Maria Carmen hopes to be able to continue working in this way in order to help support her family.

Maria Carmen is asking for a loan to purchase oil, rice, vegetable stew and other items.

She is thankful for the loan and she promises to meet her monthly repayments.

loans.use: purchase oil, rice and vegetable stew.

loans.name: Nerio

texts.en:
Nerio is a microfinance member of PMPC. He is 61 years old, married, and cultivates rice land in Oroquieta. This is how he supports his family, with a meager income of PHP 15,000 per rice cropping. 

Recently, Nerio took a loan to purchase construction materials to start renovating his house. He wants to improve his family's living conditions and maintain his membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to start renovating his house

loans.name: 1Ero De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Lo que hoy se proyecta como una pequeña ciudad hace sólo algunos años era una zona totalmente rural. El desarrollo se debió, en gran medida, a la llegada del ferrocarril ya que mucha gente se trasladó al lugar atraída por la oferta laboral y la posibilidad de crecimiento. 
   Dentro de esta localidad se integró el grupo 1ro de Mayo. Los miembros del grupo se dedican a vender diversos productos: Araceli, dulces; Adela, perfumes, zapatos y lencería; Adriana, zapatos y dulces; Luis, medicina naturista; Estela, bolsas y calzado; María, ropa, calzado y artículos de plata. 
   Don Luis o Güicho como le llaman sus conocidos es un hombre comprometido con su trabajo y su familia, es padre soltero de seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad. Don Luis trabaja toda la semana y se ha mantenido en el mismo sitio gracias a la constancia o según sus propias palabras: “las ganas de superarse y pensar de manera correcta es lo que me ha mantenido con mi negocio hasta ahorita”. Inició en la venta de artículos naturistas en 1985 y hasta el día de hoy no se ha detenido; al principio ofrecía sus productos a ras del suelo sobre una manta pero con las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar una mesa y anaqueles que le ayudan a exhibir mejor sus productos. 
   Don Luis ha invertido los préstamos anteriores para comprar más medicamentos naturistas como pastillas, jabón, aceite, gotas, etc., dependiendo de las necesidades de sus clientes debido a que siempre busca ofrecer la mejor variedad y el mejor precio. 
   En esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo para comparar gotas, jabón y cremas necesarias en el negocio. También pretende poder establecerse formalmente en un local de la zona. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la calle frente a la casa de Doña Braulia. Don Luis es el único hombre del grupo.
texts.en:
What is now today a small city was only a short time ago a rural district. The development here is thanks to the railway system whose job prospects which attracted a lot of people to the area.

In this city, the group The 1st of May (Primer de Mayo) has formed and sells a variety of goods: Araceli sells sweets; Adela sells perfumes, shoes and lingerie; Adriana sells shoes and sweets; Luis sells natural medicines; Estela sells purses and shoes; Maria sells clothing, shoes and silver products.

Don Luis, or Güicho as his friends call him, is a hard working and dedicated family man. He is a single father of six children, five of whom are now adults. Don Luis works all week and keeps his same locale thanks to constant business and, in his words, "the desire to get ahead and to think things through is what has helped me run my business until now."

He began selling natural products in 1985 and he has not stopped since. When he began his business, he sold his wares by organizing them on a rug on the ground, but he has since been able to invest in a table and shelves that help him display his products.

Don Luis has invested previous loans in purchasing more natural medicines like pills, soap, oil, eye drops etc, depending on the needs of his clients. They always come to him for the superior variety and best pricing around.

He would like to use this loan to purchase eye drops, soaps and lotions he needs for his business. He also wants to open a more formal establishment in this area of the city. *The photo was taken on the street in front of Doña Braulia's home. Don Luis is the only male member of the group.

loans.use: to purchase eye drops, soap and lotions.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a widow with five adult-age children and lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. Aurelia is a businesswoman who makes copra; she buys whole coconuts for this. She has had this business for 22 years and supported her family, especially her children's education until they got jobs of their own.  

She requested a loan to pay for more inventory of whole coconuts for her copra business. Aurelia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to own a space near town so that she can cater to more customers from different barangays (neighborhoods) for a good business opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory of whole coconuts for her copra business

loans.name: Rhea Lyn

texts.en:
Rhea Lyn works hard to support her family. Rhea Lyn is married and has a direct selling of Fuller Life products business in the Philippines.

Rhea Lyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products from Fuller Life to sell to her customers.

Rhea Lyn has been in this business for two years now.

Rhea Lyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Fuller Life to sell to her customers

loans.name: Twekambe Paacwa Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a male, age 33 years, a father to two children. 

He owns pool tables in Kagadi, Uganda, from which he earns a living. Having started out with a retail shop eight years ago, he felt he needed something better than that to appeal to his community. 

From pool tables he is introducing betting, and that is the reason he wants the loan. 

He dreams of educating his children in future. He is a member of Twekambe Paacwa group, where members guarantee each other to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy betting machines.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rona is 32 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Rona has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rona requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rona has been in this business for one year. In the future, Rona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Anecita has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 44 años de edad, es muy trabajador y luchador, está acompañado y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. 

Carlos, se dedica a la albañilería, pero también es agricultor; él trabaja los 7 días de la semana,  cuando tiene mucho trabajo, él prefiere no descansar.

Carlos, necesita el crédito porque quiere iniciar en un nuevo negocio, él quiere comprar huevos para vender y también quiere arreglar una parte de su casa, porque está un poco deteriorada.

Carlos, desea poder sacar adelante a su familia y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old, hard working and lives with his wife and two children.

Carlos is a brick layer, but he is also a farmer. He works every day of the week and when he has a lot of work available, he prefers not to rest.

Carlos needs a loan in order to invest in a new business. He wants to purchase eggs to resell and he also wants to repair a part of his home with his currently in disrepair.

Carlos hopes to get his family ahead and to give a better future to his children.

loans.use: purchase eggs to sell and to repair part of his home.

loans.name: Zoila Piedad

texts.es: Piedad es una señora muy amable de 51 años de edad, Piedad  se dedica desde que era muy joven a la crianza de animales menores, gaderia y la agricultura, el esposo de Piedad se dedica a trabajar de chofer, con el dinero del credito  Piedad va a comprar pollos ya que comenta es un buen negocio, Piedad vive con su esposo, su unica hija y una nieta que esta estudiando, Piedad tiene loa aspiracion de seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su familia y tener una vejez digna junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Piedad, age 51, is a very friendly woman.  Ever since she was very young she has been raising animals and working with livestock and in agriculture.  Her husband works as a driver.

Piedad will use the loan to buy chickens.  She says that it is a good business.

Piedad lives with her husband, her only daughter, and a granddaughter who goes to school.

Piedad wants to continue working for the well-being of her family, and she wants to live her old age with dignity together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Christina is 45 years old, she is a widow and has six children who are still at school. For five years now, she has been supporting her family with a mama lishe (local restaurant) business, serving breakfast and lunch foods. Christina starts working from 07am to 06pm daily and is able to make a small profit per month. 

This is her sixth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among her three-member group called Kakakuona. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous credits, since paid back successfully, to improve her business (she bought food and cooking ingredients for her mama lishe). She also bought a plot of land for her family. 

Christina earned some extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. She is so thankful and really appreciates Kiva for its loan support to her group. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. 

Christina will use this credit request to buy kilos of rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar for her mama   lishe.

loans.use: to buy kilos of rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar for her mama lishe.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MINIBANK.
La socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de transporte, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua alquilando sus carros a los diferentes clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota. 
La socia solicito el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
The member of this communal bank belongs to MINIBANK.

She works in transportation. She is a responsible and hard working and runs a business where she rents cars to different customers in need of this service. By running this business, she has been able to support her family.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to meet her monthly payments.

She is asking for a loan in order to maintain her car.

loans.use: to maintain her car.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 60 years old and married with two children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Emelia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jeannie Rose

texts.en:
Jeannie Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Jeannie Rose has been in this business for 15 years. Jeannie Rose earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jeannie Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old and has five children. Leonora is married, and her five children are in school.

Leonora is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married mother of 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old, and 4 of her children are currently in school.

Lucia has an Avon direct sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional Avon products to resell to her customers.

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products to resell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Rebecca

texts.en:
Ma. Rebecca is 49 years old and is married with 4 children.

Ma. Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 15 years, and she also earns income from food vending.

Ma. Rebecca aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 63 years old and is married with 5 children.

Teodora earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teodora has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Teodora is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia Adriana

texts.es: A sus 32 años de edad Lucia es madre soltera, su hija tiene 10 años y ya asiste a la escuela, Lucia vive en el campo y comenta que en este lugar a lo unico que se puede dedicaer es a la agricultura y ganaderia, Lucia  comenta que termino sus estudios primerios y a sus 13 años ya salia junto a su madre a cuidar el ganado, Lucia en la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de ganado y solicita el credito para comprar terneros y mediante la crianza y comercializacion de estos animales es como obtiene sus ingresos para los gastos de su hija, Lucia aspira darle los estudios a su hija y que mediante la obtencion de un titulo tenga un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 32 year-old single mother. Her daughter is 10 years old and in school. Lucia lives in the country, and she points out that the only things one can do here are farm and raise livestock. 

She explains that she completed primary school, and at the age of 13 she was already working with her mother raising livestock. She currently raises cattle and is seeking a loan to buy calves. 

Raising and selling these animals is how she earns her income, which she uses to cover expenses for her daughter. Lucia aspires to give her daughter the opportunity for an education so that by getting a degree she will have a good future.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land before winter starts.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan un hombre trabajador y dedicado que trabaja de sol a sol, para obtener sus ingresos  y mantener a su familia, él cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior el logro comprar sus semillas de papas y fertilizantes y gracias a Dios logro muy buena cosecha y ahora su cultivo ha ido aumentando, Juan ahora necesita de un nuevo crédito porque no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder comprar sus semillas, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.
Juan tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para seguir cultivando y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working man, dedicated to working from sunup to sunset to obtain his income and maintain his family. He says that thanks to the last loan he managed to buy potato seeds and fertilizer and thanks to God he had a good harvest and his crops have been increased.

Juan now needs a new loan as he doesn't have sufficient capital to buy his seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor. Juan has hopes of getting the loan to continue growing and continue to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Wiñasun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WIÑASUN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Challabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina ella es viuda y tiene 41 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y papa, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de agricultura.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members profiled here belong to the communal bank WIÑASUN. This bank is located in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cuzco.

The associate is Mrs. Agripina. She is a widow, 41 years old, and has one son. She works in agriculture and she has her own land where she grows corn and potatoes. She works from 6am to 5pm. She has many years of experience and things are going well. Her dream is to purchase more land. But the current loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

The other members of the group sell animals, grains, run a grocery store or also work in agriculture.

Agripina is thankful for those who are helping make her dream come true and she promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Aloran, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family, and she has been able to provide for them by doing this type of work. 

Now, Francisca wishes to plant a good variety of bananas on her coconut farm to increase the farm's yield. However, she is in need of working capital. 

Francisca presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to dig the soil and plant the banana seedlings. 

Francisca has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to dig the soil and plant banana seedlings

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 52-year-old single woman from Oroquieta, Philippines. To provide for her needs, she is engaged in her own retail business. She sells cell phone loads and has had her business for more than 7 years now. She finds it appealing because she can earn income easily. 

Agnes has requested a loan to pay for additional cell phone loads to resell. Expanding her inventory will mean an increase in her income, since she is the only cell phone load retailer in her neighborhood. 

Agnes has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and live with a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone loads to resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a businesswoman who earns income through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn, 31 years old, has passion for selling. She has been in her sari-sari (convenience) store business for 10 years in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 3 children. 

In 2012, Alyn became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She finds the cooperative to be an institution where she can put her full trust and feel that she is one of the owners. Alyn took out a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase additional inventory and to have working capital. With the help given, she is thankful to PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to have working capital

loans.name: Venencia

texts.en:
Venencia makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Aloran, in the Philippines. She has been able to provide for her family doing this type of work. Venencia now wishes to plant a good variety of bananas on the coconut farm for additional yield. However, she is in need of working capital. 

Venencia presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to pay for labor to hole and plant banana seedlings.  Venencia has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for labor to hole and plant banana seedlings

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann has a retail business selling floor rugs and mops in their barangay (village) and neighborhoods. She is single and lives with her parents in Talic, Oroquieta.

She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through PMPC to pay for more inventory of floor rugs and mops.

She has been in this business for eight years now. Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory of floor rugs and mops.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Juliana has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Juliana has been in this business for 8 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Betiliana

texts.en:
Betiliana is 54 years old and married with three children. Betiliana works very hard to provide for them.

Betiliana runs a general store in the Philippines where she sells various items; she has been in this business for three years. She has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, candies, noodles, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

Betiliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, candies, noodles, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a married mother of 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 30 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Jeanette has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy spare parts and keep up the maintenance of her bicycle.

Jeanette has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and keep up the maintenance of her bicycle.

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miriam se ha caracterizado por ser emprendedora y honesta, desde hace más de 10 años inició con la venta de enchiladas en su casa y ahora es dueña de una comidería que le genera ingresos económicos. Ella se siente útil y activa al poder apoyar con los gastos de su hogar. 
Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para la compra de plátanos, arroz, tortilla, cebolla, aceite, etc. Así como para comprar sillas y mesas plásticas. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer productos de calidad y dará una mejor presentación del negocio.
texts.en: Miriam is known for being enterprising and honest. More than 10 years ago she started selling enchiladas from her house and now she is the owner of a cafe which generates economic income. She feels useful and active being able to help with the household expenses. Nonetheless she is requesting a loan to buy plantains, rice, tortillas, onion, oil, etc. as well as to buy plastic chairs and tables. This will be of help as she will be able to offer quality products and make her business look more attractive.

loans.use: to buy plantains, rice, tortilla, onion, oil, etc. as well as buying plastic chairs and tables.

loans.name: Leidy Elizabeth

texts.es: Leidy es madre soltera, a sus 29 años de edad tiene 2 hijas de las edades de 4 años y la otra de 6 meses. Leidy es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable de sus hijas ya que comenta que el padre de las niñas no le apoya en ningun gasto para ellas. Leidy paga arriendo en un cuartito donde funciona su tienda general, Leidy va  a invertir el dinero del credito en la comprar de arroz, azucar, fideos, colas, pan y demas productos que ofrece en su  tienda. Leidy tiene la aspiracion de comprar mas marcaderia para variar los productos y asi mejorar su negocio ya que a la vez que atiende su negocio tambien cuida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Leidy is a 29 year-old single mother. She has two daughters, one is four and the other is six months old.  Leidy is a very hard-working woman. She is responsible for her daughters. She says that their father does not help her to support any of their expenses. 

Leidy rents a small room where she operates her general store. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, sodas, bread and other products that she sells in her store. 

Leidy hopes to buy more merchandise to offer a variety of products and thus improve her business, since she takes care of both her business and her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other products for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Mbajue Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas Mbajue está en su ciclo número 19 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo antiguo que viene trabajando arduamente, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la  señora Angelica quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas que ella misma hace y luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace de todo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Angelica pone todo de su para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y de esa forma poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas Mbajue Group is in its 19th cycle with the Women’s Communal Bank Program. It is an old group that has been working arduously.  They are also part of the Elimination of Poverty Program, so that each one of them can understand her living conditions and be able to improve them accordingly.

One of the members is Señora Angelica, who works making and selling food. She makes it herself and goes out to sell it later as a street vendor. She is a very hardworking woman who does everything she can to be able to grow and get ahead. Angelica makes every effort to be able to improve her living conditions and help her loved ones. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase green leafy vegetables, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other items, so that in this way, she can continue working and striving as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing and striving.

loans.use: to purchase green leafy vegetables, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other items, in order to make food to sell.

loans.name: Rimber

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MINIBANK.
El socio sigue  dedicándose a su negocio de agencia de viajes, el socio continua vendiendo paquetes turísticos como Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado entre otros, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar boletos entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank MINIBANK.

He makes a living at a travel agency where he sells tourist packages to locations like Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado and others. He is a responsible and hard working person and it is through his work that he is able to support his family.

He is asking for a loan in order to help him finance purchasing more tickets for the packages.

He is thankful for this opportunity and he promises to make his monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchase tickets.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children who are now adults and of school age. 

Juliet has been earning a living from her coconut buying and copra processing businesses for 15 years. At present, she's also engaged in hog raising. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month with these types of business activities. 

Juliet has requested a loan to purchase groceries and other items for her family. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to become a major copra buying location.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and other items for her family.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She is 36 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Josephine is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Josephine continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking mother from Plaridel. She is 52 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Rebecca has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. 

She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Rebecca hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 52 years old and married. She has always dreamed of managing her own business to support her five children.

She is now engaged in running a quarrying business, buying and selling sand and gravel to the local community. She used her loan as working capital to pay for more loads of sand and gravel to meet the demands of her increasing customers.

She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to pay for more loads of sand and gravel to meet the demands of her increasing customers.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.en:
Ruperta makes a profit through her retailing business, buying and selling a variety of commodities like rice for the local community. Ruperta never gets tired of displaying and tending her stall since she has a passion for selling; she earns a meager income from her business that sufficiently supports her family. Ruperta is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase more sacks of various types of rice to sell; this will help her to increase her inventories and her sales. Ruperta continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of a variety of types of rice to sell

loans.name: Hernan Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo tiene 41 años de edad, Gustavo tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, Gustavo crecio en el campo y comenta que sus padres le enseñaron la menera de cuidar el ganado, Gustavo desde que era muy joven se dedica  a la agricultura y ganaderia, con el dinero del credito Gustavo va  a comprar terneros para tenerlos en terrenos por los que paga arriendo por la hierba que comen sus animales, Gustavo tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio mediante la crianza y comercializacion de mas terneros y  asi lograr que aumentar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y apoyar a sus hijos en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 41 years old. Gustavo has two children who are adults. He grew up in the countryside and tells us that his parents taught him how to take care of cattle. Gustavo, since he was young, has been dedicated to farming and livestock. With the money from the loan, Gustavo will buy calves which he will keep on land which he rents for the grass that his animals eat.

Gustavo aspires to improve his business through raising and selling more cattle and thus manage to improve his income to cover his expenses and support his children with what they need.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 43 years old with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Merlina has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Jenny Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda crecio con su familia que tiene bajos recursos economicos, Fernanda al seguir el ejemplo de su madre se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Fernanda tambien se dedica a trabajar de cocinera en una casa. Fernanda dice que el dinero del credito lo necesita para comprar pollos y que es asi como obtiene sus ingresos, a  sus 23 años de edad vive con su madre y con una hermana, Fernanda tiene la aspiracion de seguir trabajando de empleada y tambien mejorar su negocio para tener los ingresos que le permitan ayudar a su madre en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Fernanda grew up with her family who have few economic resources. Fernanda, following her mother's example, is dedicated to raising young animals. She is also dedicated to working as a cook in a house. She says that the money from the loan is needed to buy chickens and that it is this way that she earns income. At 23, she lives with her mother and a sister. Fernanda aspires to keep working as an employee and also improve her business to have the income that allows her to help her mother with the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling Personal Collection and Avon products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

Alejandra has been in this business for five years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una señora casada, esta pasando por sus 48 años, Beatriz tiene 2 hijas de las edades de 19 y 29 años de edad, la joven de 19 años asiste a la universidad, el esposo de Beatriz trabaja de mecanico de autos y motocicletas, Beatriz solcita el dinero del credito para invetirlo comprando una vaca ya que comenta que al vivir en el campo la mejor opcion de tener ingresos es la de criar ganado y comercializar leche que saca de las vacas, Beatiz tiene la aspiracion de seguir comprando mas vacas para y asi mejorar su negocio, Beatriz es una señora amorosa con su familia y su aspiracion es que al pasar el tiempo su hija le de el orgulo de verle a su hija hecha una profecional.
texts.en:
Beatriz is married and is 48 years old. She has two daughters who are 19 and 29 years old. Her youngest goes to the university and her husband works as a mechanic for cars and motorcycles.

Beatriz is asking for a loan in order to purchase a cow. She says that because she lives in a rural area, a cow is the best way to bring in money by caring for it and selling the milk.

Beatriz dreams of purchasing more cows and to grow her business.

Beatriz is a loving woman and her dream is to spend more time with her daughter and to see her grow into a woman with a successful career.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 43 years old, and four of her children are currently in school.

Gemma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Gemma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, de 22 años de edad, está acompañada desde hace 5 años, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas y tienen 2 hijos. 

Ana, es ama de casa, pero también le ayuda a su pareja en la realización de su trabajo, todo lo hacen juntos para salir adelante a su familia.

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar maquinaria para continuar trabajando en las estructuras metálicas y que su trabajo sea más eficiente.

Ana, sueña con crecer económicamente a través de su trabajo y darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 22 years old, she has had the same partner for 5 years and he makes a living making metal structures. They have two children.

Ana takes care of the house, but she also helps her husband in his work. They do everything they can to get their family ahead.

Ana needs this loan to purchase machinery in order to be able to continue making these metal structures and to make their work more efficient.

Ana dreams of economic growth and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: purchase machinery to help her continue making metal structures.

loans.name: Saul Alexander

texts.es:
Saúl, es un hombre joven, está casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa.

Saul, es Licenciado en Comunicaciones y es empleado en una empresa.
