Saul, necesita el crédito para reparar su casa, porque ya se acerca la época lluviosa y no quiere mojarse ni que se dañen sus pertenencias.

Saul, desea ampliar su casa y convertirla en la casa de sus sueños para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Saúl is a young man, married, and father of two. His wife works at home.

Saúl has a degree in Communications and is employed with a company.

He needs a loan today in order to make repairs on his home since the rainy season is approaching and he doesn't want his belongings inside the home to get wet.

His dream is to expand his home and to convert it into a dream home for him and his family.

loans.use: make repairs on his home.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov, 60, lives in a small community of Prey Veng Province. He has five children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business in a farmland that is located near his house. He has been involved with this type of business since 1980. He is able to earn an average daily income of USD 5.00.

He wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a home solar energy system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a home solar energy system.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is married and from Unidos, Plaridel. She has been a wholesaler of bananas in their town for almost 10 years. From this long time experience of selling, she already has high knowledge in dealing this kind of business. 

Even though there are many competitors in the town, Virgilia still gets more customers above the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

Now Virgilia is planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business, which is creating a small pig pen for additional income in the near future. 

To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 500 kilos of banana for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase 500 kilos of banana for wholesale

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora has mastered her hog raising business in Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her husband in raising their family. 

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful for the availability of credit to fully support her business. Just as now she takes care of her hog raising business and so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run to them for any financing needs. 

Now the loan of Php 20,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 65 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children now at their adult age.

Pedrita has been engaged in managing her own copra trading business for more than 30 years already. She earns approximately 5,500 PHP each month doing this type of business activity.

She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair and renovations.

Pedrita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, she hopes to become a more progressive copra trader in the area.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair and renovations.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 61 years old and lives in Burgos, Aloran, Philippines. She is married with four adult-age children. She is good at doing her farming activities and has had this business for more than a decade.

She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce. She recently became a member of Paglaum MPC.

In the future, Margarita hopes to venture into a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is from Aloran. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her eatery business. It began with selling packed dishes to their neighbors until she opened a small space for the eatery. To generate more income, Evelyn joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her business in March of 2014. She became a MIGS member, and she is applying for her second loan for 5,000 PHP to buy additional raw ingredients for her eatery business. She hopes that her business will continue so that she can provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her eatery business

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Rovelyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Rovelyn is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 56 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children who are now adults. 

Nelia earns a living from dried fish vending and a rice "palay" trading business. She's been in the business for 10 years already. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month from doing this kind of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to purchase an additional stock of dried fish and rice "palay" to sell. 

Nelia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business through acquisition of a market stall.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of dried fish and rice "palay"

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years of age and lives in Aloran, Philippines. She is married with two children.  Nancy is engaged in a retailing business; she buys merchandise in bulk for retail. She has had this business for two years now. 

She requested a loan to pay for the pawned cocoland for her desired farming project. The income from her business shall be used to pay off the loan she requested from PMPC. 

She has been a member of PMPC for a year already. In the future, Nancy hopes to have a good standard of living with her family and adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to pay for the pawned cocoland for her desired farming project

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
When they got married, Virginia and her husband were both farmers. They have cultivated their rice land in Sindangan and have yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, Virginia applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Virginia knew that she had to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Virginia hopes to buy agricultural land to potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 55 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Belen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, personal product care and other groceries.

Belen has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Nenita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as body lotion, perfume, and other personal care products to sell to customers.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as body lotion, perfume, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 25 years old with three children. With one child in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Cristina has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 56 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. For the past six years, Filomena has run a general store in the Philippines.

Filomena is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as condiments, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy condiments, home care products, and groceries

loans.name: Rohany

texts.en:
Rohany is 43 years old and a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. For the past 17 years, Rohany has run a general store in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rohany is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as candies, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other personal care products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase candies, soft-drinks, canned goods, and personal care products

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana works hard to support her family. Cresenciana is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cresenciana has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Cresenciana has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Cresenciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 37 years old and all of her children are in school.

Marites has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, and for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Marites has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, and for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Anneh's Group

texts.en:
Anneh is the leader of her group in Matete District, and she is representing 16 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of 3 children. Anneh joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Anneh decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Anneh's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 9.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights, as, even though Anneh decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 23 years old and has one child in school. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Erkakhol

texts.ru: Ее зовут Эркахол. Ей 34 года. Она вместе с мужем и несовершеннолетними детьми проживает на районе Кубадиён. Эркахол очень активная женщина. Она справляется и с домашними делами, и следить за детьми и также заниматься растениеводством. Экракол в этом году посадила пшеницу, картофель и помидоры. Она уже посеяла урожай. Ей осталось только обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Ей не хватило денег на приобретения минеральных удобрений и она приняла решения обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Erkakhol is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and minor children in the Qudabiyon region. Erkakhol is a very active woman. She copes with the housework and looking after her children while also growing crops. This year, Erkakhol has planted wheat, potatoes and tomatoes. She has already sown her crop, and now all that remains for her to do is to condition the soil with mineral fertilizer in order to get a rich and high-quality harvest. She did not have enough money to buy the mineral fertilizer, and so she has taken the decision to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente cultiva maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos cerca de su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para cultivo como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her life's companion and her son. For the last 20 years, she has dedicated herself to agriculture, cultivating principally corn and beans. She sells her  produce near her place of residence and with what she obtains from these sales, she manages to cover some of their household expenses.

Rosa is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs for her crops, including fertilizers, manure, plague controls, herbicides, etc. As a result,, she hopes to have a better income.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, manure, plague controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Jaime Cecilio

texts.es: Jaime de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su tres hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, además trabaja como transportista, desde hace 4 años que se dedica a la agricultura, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y así seguir con sus cultivos para  tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jaime is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his 3 children. Her works in agriculture, growing corn and beans and he also works in transportation. He has been farming for 4 years. selling his products in the neighboring towns. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs like manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc. and continue with his crops to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Marichu has a hog raising business. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs. She wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is a businesswoman from Tangub City. She is 26 years old, single, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a good income. This is how she helps her parents and her siblings to earn for their living. 

Genevieve is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken two loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she's accessing her third loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Genevieve continues to look for better business opportunities and hopes to have a stable financial status to benefit her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria works raising swine in Lagag, Sindangan, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and supports her family. Neria’s lowest point was when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to access credit to support her business. Neria takes her PMPC membership as seriously as she does her hog-raising business. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always be eligible for any financing needs. 

Neria is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her piglets. Her loan will also help her build a concrete pig pen to improve sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase feed and animal vitamins and help build a concrete pen

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is from Oroquieta. She is a widow and has four adult children. 

She joined Paglaum MPC in 2009, and she appreciates the co-op's programs and services. For a living, she engages in selling assorted fruits, vegetables, and dried fish in their neighborhood, enabling her to support her needs. This source of income has existed for many years as she was widowed. 

As Amparo needed additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in an amount of 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to pay for more stock of assorted fruits, vegetables, and dried fish to sell. 

Through this purchase, she hopes to increase her income so she is able to provide for her daily needs. In the future, she hopes to save more money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of assorted fruits, vegetables, and dried fish

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 58 years old and married. He lives in Sindangan, Philippines, where he works distributing wholesale goods. Rolando joined PMPC in March of 2012 to access its programs and services. 

Rolando is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy a variety of commodities such as garlic, onion, and ginger to sell wholesale in the local market and in nearby towns. This will be his fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities such as garlic, onion, and ginger

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Harlika

texts.en:
Harlika, married, makes a good living with every quarter on her coconut farm in Burgos, Aloran in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Harlika has been able to provide her children a good education, until they graduated and secured stable jobs. 

Harlika pawned her 2-hectare cocoland when her children entered college. Now, she wishes to pay for the acquisition of her pawned cocoland, for which she applied for a loan from PMPC. 

Harlika has high hopes that she will have a high yield on her farm next quarter. She wishes nothing more than to live happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of her pawned cocoland

loans.name: Savador

texts.en: Savador owns and manages cottages and spaces for rental in Oroquieta. This has been going well and supporting the needs of the family. Recently, he borrowed an amount to purchase construction materials for his cottages and spaces to provide a safe and comfortable stay, and to be able to draw more occupants. This will help him sustaining the needs of the family and help to support his grandchildren's education. He wants to expand his business and aspires to have a commercial building in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his cottages and spaces, to provide a safe and comfortable stay and to draw more occupants.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla, married, lives in Sindangan, Philippines. For a living, Perla manages her rice farm and raises hogs as well. Since she has been doing this for more than two decades, and she is a master at her job. Perla joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to access insurance and credit. She is hardworking and determined to pursue her goals in order to sustain her needs. Perla is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm. She also plans to purchase an additional two piglets, animal feed, and vitamins. This will greatly help her to boost her income. Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of land to expand her rice farming activities and venture into the rice-retailing business. Perla is now helping to support her grandson in obtaining a college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, two piglets, animal feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila earns an income through selling various seafood like shells and seaweed. She also produces shrimp pastes to sell. 

Leonila is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital to purchase more stock of a variety seafood to expand her business and increase her sales. 

She is on her way to repaying her loan from her new profits. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to be used as additional working capital to purchase more stock of a variety seafood to expand her business and increase her sales

loans.name: Laurincia

texts.en:
Laurincia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Laurincia is 36 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Laurincia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Laurincia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Benmerisa

texts.en: Benmerisa, 38, is a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For one year, Benmerisa has had a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 6000 PHP loan amount through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, Benmerisa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 40 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Rosenda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Rosenda has been in this business for four years now.  In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Bernadette

texts.en:
Ma. Bernadette is 30 years old with one child in school. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Ma. Bernadette works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Bernadette is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as eggs, condiments, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Nurul Priyanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Nurul. Nurul lives in Lumajang, located in East Java, around four hours from Surabaya, the capital city of East Java, Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her child. 

Nurul owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. As a woman, Nurul realized that she has to help her husband to get more income, that's why she decided to join Ruma. Her community sees her as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Nurul needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. 

Nurul’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Nurul is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза 32 лет. Она жительница города Кайракум. Гулноза замужем и мать троих детей. Дочкам 10 и 8 лет. Сыну 5 лет. Сын ходит в садик. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, чтобы заработать и обеспечить детей и жену. Гулноза спокойная и шустрая женщина. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. В швейном деле ей нравится сшить национальное платье и ежедневный доход. Гулноза хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она старается зарабатывать, чтобы улучшить финансовые положение семьи. Гулноза решила купить новую швейную машинку и швейные принадлежности, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и увеличить доход. Поэтому она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. У Гулнозы нет другого варианта кроме кредит. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Gulnoza is 32 years old. She is a resident of the town of Kayrakum. Gulnoza is married and the mother of three children. Her daughters are ten and eight years old, and her son is five. Her son goes to kindergarten. Her husband works away in the Russian Federation to earn money and provide for his children and wife. Gulnoza is a calm and nimble woman. She sews women's clothes in her home. What she likes about the business is sewing national dress and getting daily income. Gulnoza does her work well. She is trying to earn money to improve her family's financial position. Gulnoza has decided to buy a new sewing machine and sewing supplies in order to improve her workflow and increase her income. She has therefore turned to you for a loan. Gulnoza does not have any other option besides a loan. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 34 years old from Oroquieta.  She and her husband have been farmers, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops. This is how they earn a living.  Gia earns 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

As a new member of PMPC, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and to be able to engage in agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Leberato

texts.en:
Leberato has a retail business selling gasoline and motor oil in their barangay (neighborhood). He uses bottles of soft drinks as liter containers for his retail business. Leberato also buys and sells junk materials like plastics, metals, and other scrap. He has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through PMPC to restock liters of gasoline to sell and pay for an inventory of junk materials. 

Leberato has been in this business for two years now. Leberato would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to restock liters of gasoline to sell and pay for an inventory of junk materials

location.town: Tangub-Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la agricultura principalmente cultiva maíz y frijoles desde hace 15 años, también trabaja en una empresa privada, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlo en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicidas, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, aged 29, lives in his own home with his life partner.

In the past 15 years, he has been making a living working in agriculture, mainly growing maize and beans. He also works at a private company.

When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the picture. Then he sells it at the different markets located close to where he lives. 

He is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer, herbicides, inorganic fertilizers, seeds, and the like. In this way, he will improve his income and, thus, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, herbicides, inorganic fertilizers, seeds, and the like.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 52 years old with six children. Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She has been a member in good standing with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (Kiva's partner) for three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to 10,000 PHP for the purchase of new nets and fishing supplies. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see all her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 66 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Anita has been in this business for two years now.  In the future, Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Arin

texts.en:
Arin is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arin is 22 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arin has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Juvy

texts.en:
Ma. Juvy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Ma. Juvy has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell like hotdogs, tocino, etc.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell like hotdogs, tocino, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y maicillo tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder empezar con sus siembras y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man in the photo with his face blurred is twenty-six years old, and lives in a high-risk area. He works in agriculture, growing corn and sorghum, which he has been doing for the past five years. He sells his crops in the surrounding areas near where he lives. He has his own house where he lives with his family. He is requesting a loan to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, etc. and improve the land shown in the photo, so he can begin planting his crops and increase his earnings to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, fertilizers, etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is a hard-working mother from from Unidos, Plaridel. For a living, Perla makes and sells pancakes. She is very diligent and she works hard for her family. Perla has benefited from her membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the coop. Perla needs a loan to purchase additional raw ingredients for pancakes. She wants to display her pancakes in shops and cafes in the area to generate more income. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 4,000 and is grateful for the loan. She deeply wishes to provide her family a descent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is a skilled potter and needs capital for her pottery business. As a mother from Lopez Jaena, she supports her family any way she can and helps her husband earn an income. She joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance. She decided to start a pottery business which has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the shape and quality of her pots. Fely has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her business to increase production.. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family. Retail businesses sell her pots, which in turn helps them earn income and support other families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her pottery business to increase production.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 46 years old, married and has six children, two currently in school.

Merly is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Merly has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ena

texts.en:
Ena is 36 years old and married with two children, both in school. Ena works very hard to provide for her family.

Ena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Ena has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Ena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, condiments, home  care products and other groceries

loans.name: Elonga B Group

texts.fr: Selemani est commerçante, membre  du groupe solidaire «Elonga B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chauffeur, âgée de 38 ans et mère de 6 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une quincaillerie dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter des câbles, morcettes de liaisons, disjoncteurs, pinces, prises, sockets, interrupteurs, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Selemani is a trader and member of the Elonga B group. She is a customer of IMF Hékima, 38 years old, married to a driver and mother to six children, who are all studying. She began her business with funds given to her by her husband. She has owned a hardware shop in a secondary market in the town for the past eight years. She is going to buy cables, terminal strips, circuit breakers, pliers, plugs, sockets, switches, etc. She would like to increase her turnover, and also be able to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to buy cables, terminal strips, circuit breakers, pliers, plugs, sockets, switches, etc.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi is a 38-year-old man from Tetritskaro district. He has a wife and student son. His wife works as a baker and gets a small income. As there is a high unemployment rate in the region, Aleksi also started working as a hired worker at the local stone factory. The family has poor living conditions, as they are unable to generate significant income to meet even basic needs. According to above-mentioned situation, Aleksi lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.  

The StartUp program created by Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1,100 USD to purchase a truck and to make it work on a private orders.  Local people will hire the truck for transfering cargoes. Aleksi thinks that the business will be profitable, and that will give him a chance to generate additional income.  

He is very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his son has a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Aleksi is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and to make it work on a private orders.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 41-year-old, married man with three children. He started a selling produce business and a retail shop business to get returns and to educate his children for self-sustainability in Kagadi, Uganda. He is hardworking for the survival of his businesses and his family's welfare. He is challenged by price fluctuations of retail products. Francis intends to use the credit to buy sugar, sodas, soap and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas, soap and maize to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking, married lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer and at the same time earns salary from the local government. She is faced with a challenge of bad weather that destroys her banana plantation, especially heavy rains characterized by heavy winds. 

Besides that, she is working hard to make sure all her children obtain education. Betty needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Felidelfa

texts.en:
Felidelfa is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Felidelfa is requesting a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nath

texts.en: Nath, 53, resides in Kampong Thom Province of Cambodia. She has eight children. To make a living and support her family, she operates a farming business, growing vegetable for sale. She has been in this career for fifteen years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day. Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is married and lives in Plaridel. Her husband earns a living via farming activities.

At the age of 40, Analy has never stopped pursuing her goals for the sake of the family. She is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. From her desire to earn additional income, she engaged in a sari-sari (small grocery) store business; PMPC stood by her to start her chosen business. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She wishes to increase her inventory and purchase bags of fertilizer for their farm.

Analy continues to seek business ideas on farming, proof that she has the determination to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and also to purchase bags of fertilizer.

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Narcisa has been in this business for 4 years. Narcisa earns more income from pig fattening.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gertrudes is 53 years old now.

Gertrudes has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gertrudes has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily works hard to support her family. Lily is married and has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines.

Lily requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell to her customers.

Lily has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Lily would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
José, de 38 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, está acompañado y vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir, producto del trabajo de toda su vida como agricultor y albañil.

José, ha sido agricultor por más de 25 años, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre desde muy temprana edad y de esa manera ha logrado llevar el pan a su hogar; de vez en cuando es buscado por la gente de su comunidad, para realizar pequeños trabajos de albañilería.		

La temporada de siembra de maíz ya casi comienza y esta vez José, no tiene el dinero suficiente para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno y es por esta razón que está solicitando ayuda económica, para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y semilla para sembrar.

José, desea obtener una buena cosecha, para poder darle a su familia el alimento necesario y los granos restante venderlos para tener dinero y darle a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela.
texts.en:
Jose, thirty-eight years old, is a very hardworking man. He is married and lives with his wife and their three children in the house he managed to build himself with a great deal of effort, a product of his life-long work as a farmer and bricklayer. 

Jose has been a farmer for over twenty-five years, he learned the work from his father at a very young age, and in this way he has managed to feed his family. Occasionally members of the community seek him out to do small bricklaying jobs. 

The time for planting corn has almost arrived, and this time Jose does not have sufficient funds to plant 14,000 square meters of land. For this reason he is seeking financial assistance, to buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds to plant. 

Jose would like to raise a good crop, so he can feed his family and sell the surplus grain to earn money for his children so they can go to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds to plant.

loans.name: Jarin Ariel

texts.es:
Jarin  es un pequeño emprendedor que vive en la zona norte de Nicaragua. Durante toda su vida, ha estado relacionado a actividades agrícolas, siendo el café uno de los rubros que él conoce muy bien desde pequeño. Solo pudo estudiar los dos primeros años de primaria, por lo que una de sus motivaciones para trabajar fuerte en su pequeña finca, es darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar.

En los últimos años, se ha venido esforzando para darle un manejo semi-tecnificado a su plantación de café, que es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. Como parte de este proceso, él está solicitando financiamiento para este ciclo, a fin de asegurar la adquisición de  insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal y lograr una mejor cosecha este año, y con ello mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Le animamos a contribuir con Jarin para que pueda lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Jarin is a small entrepreneur who lives in the northern part of Nicaragua.  He has been farming, raising coffee, his whole life and this is one of the fields he knows very well.  He was only able to attend the first few years of elementary school and this was one of his motivations for working hard on his small farm, so he can provide his children the opportunity to attend school.

For the past few years he has been working to give his coffee plantation a semi-technical management.  This is his family’s main source of income.  As part of this process, he is asking for a loan for this cycle.  He wants to buy supplies and fertilizers for his plants so that he can have a better harvest this year and increase his income for his family’s wellbeing.  We encourage you to help Jarin reach his goal.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en: Theogene is 36 years old. He is married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years.  They all go to school. He owns a restaurant and he has been in business for the past three years, while his wife is a business lady. With the loan, he would like to buy bananas, meat, cassava and beans in order to make more food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, meat, cassava and beans in order to make more food to sell.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Due to an error in the repayment reporting process, Nellie's first loan on Kiva was accidentally marked as fully repaid and contributing lenders were repaid their contribution. Because this was done in error and Nellie still needs funding to purchase ICT educational resources for the students in their school, her loan is being reposted to Kiva to raise support again from lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children in the community receive quality education using modern education technology

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité Kuña Guapa  es un grupo muy unido y que trabaja de manera solidaria, se ayudan las unas a las otras, y con ello quieren ir mejorando su situación de vida y las de su familia.
Ada es integrante de este grupo, ella vende perfumes de todo tipo, también fragancias, tiene siempre pedidos de sus clientes, y es con este humilde trabajo que lucha para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Quiere ir mejorando poco a poco e ir creciendo por medio de las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de perfumes varios, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, además que esto le generara mayores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Communal Bank is a very united group that works in solidarity, helping each other.  In this way, they want to go on improving their living conditions and those of their families.

Ada is a member of this group. She sells all types of perfume and fragrances, and she always has requests from her customers. It is with this humble work that she fights to be able improve her living conditions and those of her family, and she wants to keep improving by means of the training that she will be receiving.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of various perfumes so that she can continue her sales as she has been doing. In addition, this will generate more income for her to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase various perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto de 37 años de edad vive casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la albañilería de profesión trabaja por obras, también trabaja en una empresa pública desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene e de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico pero no tiene suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cerámica, cemento y arena para que el y su familia puedan vivir ms cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Roberto is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He works as a bricklayer as a profession working by contract. He has also worked in a public company for 10 years. With what he makes form his work he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He wants to make improvements to his house laying a tile floor but he does not have sufficient capital. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy tiles, cement and sand so that his family and live more comfortably and in a clean place..

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement and sand.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun, 54 years old, is a lovely mother of three children; one is single and two are married. She lives in a small community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 5.00 per day.

She lives in an old house and she wants to build a comfortable one for her family. Due to a budget shortage, she is applying for a KIVA loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as brick, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house. Through this loan, she hopes she can experience living in a comfortable house. She is thankful to all lenders with their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 42 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Josefa works very hard to provide for them.

Josefa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, dried fish, home care products and other groceries.

Josefa has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Josefa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, dried fish, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Nietha

texts.en:
Nietha works hard to support her family. Nietha is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nietha requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, eggs, banana, and flour for her business.

Nietha has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Nietha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, eggs, banana, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 24 years old with one child. Karen works very hard to provide for them.

Karen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Karen has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Karen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 48 years old, married with three children.

Liza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Liza has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Liza aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Virginia is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo, de 69 años de edad, es agricultor de profesión, está casado y su esposa le ayuda mucho con las labores de la casa y también con la agricultura; él creció junto a su padre y fue él quien le enseño a desempeñar este trabajo.

Bernardo, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, también aprendió a construir y hoy en día trabaja construyendo casas, es muy bueno en lo que hace, es por eso que la gente lo busca. 

Bernardo, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para preparar la tierra antes que empiece el invierno. 

Bernardo, sueña con mejorar su humilde vivienda y continuar trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Bernardo, aged 69, is a farmer by trade. He is married, and his wife helps him greatly with household chores and also in the fields. He grew up with his father, and it was him who taught Bernardo to follow this occupation.

Bernardo has been working in agriculture for a long time now. He also learned house construction, and nowadays he works building houses too. He is very good at what he does. For this reason, people seek him out.

Bernardo is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs to get the soil ready before winter starts.

Bernardo's dreams are to improve his humble home and to keep on working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to get the soil ready before winter starts.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. Carmelita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, and vegetables for her food production business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 3 years now.

Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, and vegetables for her food production business.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She sells mobile phones accessories in the Philippines and earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Liliosa is requesting her twenty third loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items such as chargers and cellphone cases to sell at her mobile phones accessories business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as chargers and cellphone cases

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 27 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Liza has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nolvia Yessenia

texts.es:
Nolvia, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y solo tiene un hijo.

Nolvia, está trabajando desde hace varios años en un almacén de electrodomésticos, donde con mucho esfuerzo se ha ganado la confianza de todos sus compañeros y sus jefes.

Nolvia, necesita el crédito para terminar las reparaciones de su casa, anteriormente solicito un crédito para iniciar las reparaciones y fue de mucha ayuda.

Ella desea continuar sus estudios superiores en una universidad que está cerca de su pueblo, convertirse en una profesional y tener un lugar importante en el mundo laboral, también desea darle a su hijo una buena educación.
texts.en:
Nolvia, thirty-one, is a high school graduate, married with one child. 

Nolvia has been working for several years at an appliance store, where through hard work she has been able to win the respect of all of her co-workers and managers. 

Nolvia needs a loan to finish repairs in her home; previously she had only solicited a loan to begin the repairs, and it was a tremendous help. 

She would like to pursue a higher education at a university which is close to her town, become a professional and have an important role in the workplace, she would also like to provide her child with a good education.

loans.use: to finish repairs in her home

loans.name: Nak

texts.en: Nak, 26, is a single lady who lives in the Banon district of Battambang province. The source of her income has been from rice farming and soy bean farming for eight years, and she can earn about USD 10.25 per day to support her daily expenses. This is the first loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She decided to apply for this loan in order to pay for school fees. She hopes that she can get a higher education and create her own new business.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan, 28, is a married father of a child, and lives in Battambang province. The source of his family’s income is from working for CARE Company for five years and he earns about USD 15.5 per day to support his family. This is the first loan for him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He decided to apply for this loan in order to pay for school fees and buy studying tools. He hopes that he could get a higher education and earn the chance to get a better job.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy studying tools.

loans.name: Tanti Nike

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Tanti. Tanti lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two sons. She owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she heard that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider. As a woman, Tanti realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Tanti needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Tanti’s goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Tanti is the one who is standing. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Lomas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Loma del Sur forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual las integrantes conocerán su situación de vida e ir luchando a partir de ello para poder mejorar.
Una de las que se desataca en el grupo por su dedicación y lucha es la Sra. Petronilda, quien es la presidenta del Comité, ella es limpiadora de una cancha, pero también se dedica a hacer comidas y a venderlas, y de esa manera tiene un mejor ingreso para poder ayudar a su familia.
Petronila quiere seguir con las capacitaciones, ya que sabe que de esa forma podrá seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando y mejorando.
texts.en:
The group called “Loma del Sur” is part of the Elimination of Poverty Program, through which the members will gain insight into their living conditions, and on that basis, go on fighting to be able to improve.

Señora Petronilda, the president of the communal bank, is well known in the group for her dedication and fighting spirit. She works maintaining a sports facility, but she also makes and sells food in order to have a better income so that she can help her family. Petronilda wants to continue with the training program, because she knows that this way, she will be able to continue helping her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase supplies for making her food, such as green leafy vegetables, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other things.  In this way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity to be able to keep on fighting and improving.

loans.use: to purchase green leafy vegetables, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Willian

texts.es:
El socio Wiliian al banco comunal MINIBANK.
El socio continua dedicándose a la venta de cereales, él socio lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo quinua,kiwicha y maca entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar quinua entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido feliz con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
Wiliian is a member of the comunal bank, Minibank. 

He continues to make a living selling cereals, which he has done so for many years. It has gone well thanks to the effort that he puts forth each day. He continues to sell quinoa, amaranth and maca, among other grains. He wishes to keep working to support his family.

He asks for a loan to buy quinoa and other grains. He is thankful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy quinoa among other grains

loans.name: Maryfa

texts.en:
Maryfa is a 31-year-old married woman with five children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maryfa has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maryfa has been in this business for 1 year now. In the future, Maryfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
A 42-year-old mother of four little children and a rural villager of Battambang Province, Nuon is one of the breadwinners in the family. She struggles to deal with her family’s hardship through potato farming on three hectares farmland; and for extra income, she also sell grocery items. Nuon has been working on this farmland for ten years.

This is Nuon's fourth loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). The past loans have made a positive impact on her living and ability to send her children to school. Now, she is applying for a new loan in order to buy seeds and pay for the plowing fee. She greatly hopes that she can improve her living condition and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 48 years old with 1 child, and she is a hardworking entrepreneur.

Her husband helps her in operating their business of sari-sari store (small grocery store).

She started her business to help her husband in their daily expenses and for their child's education. She at first sold some candies and snack foods in the makeshift table she put outside her house. Ma. Victoria saved the money and added items like biscuits and packed coffee which increased her income. 

Through time Ma. Victoria's sari-sari store (small grocery store) expanded and she built her store with shelves to place her items to attract more customers and to open her store for longer hours.

Today Ma. Victoria's sari-sari store earns a net of PhP 1,000-1,500 daily and she has more regular customers. Ma. Victoria wanted to add sacks of rice and noodles to be delivered to her customers to increase her income due to the increased demand of her customers.

Ma. Victoria is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy 10 sacks of rice, 1 box of noodles, 1 box of canned goods and biscuits as well as additional items to sell in her store.

Ma. Victoria hopes to expand her store to generate more income to help more with the education of her only child and to save for their future old age.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice, 1 box of noodles, 1 box of canned goods and biscuits as well as additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla has a piece of agricultural land in Mahayag. She grows rice and corn and earns well for her family. 

She is thankful that Paglaum MPC has been her constant financing partner for her farming activities. Now, she applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. 

Perla hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Solsticio

texts.es:
Solsticio es un hombre de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 1 año, y su negocio es la confección de abrigos para damas. 
Él es buen padre, independiente, emprendedor, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ un lugar caracterizado por la manufactura y venta de ropa por mayor, como: zapatos, chamarras, chompas, mantillas y edredones, etc., de fabricación local. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Solsticio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultural general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su bebé que ya camina. Viven en una casa propia de los suegros construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de abrigos para dama, como; chamarras, sacos, sacones, camperas, etc., actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en su taller ubicado en un cuarto de su casa, turnándose con su esposa para realizar la venta. “aprendí confección trabajando 12 horas diarias en los talleres de costura en la ciudad de buenos aires, regresé y abrí mi propio taller…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que por el clima de lugar sus confecciones se venden constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para acceder a material de trabajo. Su sueño es crear una marca de ropa para vender sus propios diseños, él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para aumentar su producción y vender por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Solsticio solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para confeccionar abrigos de mujer y venderlos por mayor.
texts.en:
Solstico,39, lives with his wife and his one-year-old son.  His business is the manufacture of coats for women.  He is a good father, independent, enterprising, constant, responsible, and hard-working.  He carries out his work in the "Max Paredes" zone, a place characterized by the manufacture and sales of wholesale clothing, such as shoes, jackets, sweaters, scarves, quilts, etc. of local manufacture.  The climate is cold and dry with a daily temperature which varies between two and 14 degrees Celsius.
Solsticio is dark-complected; with brown eyes; short, black hair; short stature; a thin frame; and his mother tongue is Aymara which he speaks with his family, though he speaks Spanish in public and in his work.  He shares his life with his wife who makes a living in the same business and with his baby who is already walking.  They live in his in-law's house constructed of brick and mortar with a corrugated zinc roof, which has running water, electricity, and drainage.  
His work is the manufacture of coats for women, such as jackets, bags, large sacks, coats, etc., work that he does every day of the week in his workshop located in a room in his house, taking turns with his wife to bring about the sales.  "I learned sewing working 12 hours a day in the tailoring workshops of the city of Buenos Aires.  I returned and opened my own workshop," he says.  The advantage of his business is that because of the climate, his creations sell constantly.  The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to access working material.  
His dream is to create a brand of clothing in order to sell his own designs.  He wishes to expand his business by way of the purchase of an industrial sewing machine in order to increase his production and sell wholesale.  This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in three years which is dedicated to this activity in independent form.  It is for these reasons that Solsticio is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to create coats for women and sell them wholesale.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to manufacture women's coats and sell them wholesale.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melinda is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Melinda has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melinda has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 42 years old and married with one child.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Margie has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Margie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Los Diamantes De Macamango Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES DE MACAMANGO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisa ella es soltera y tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ganaderia.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "Los Diamantes de Macamango".  This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana which belongs to the province of La Convencion and the department of Cusco.
The partner Marisa, 39, is single and has two children.  She works in her cereal sales business.  She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa.  The partner works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She has been working in this business for four years and it goes well for her.  Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her cereals.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.
The other partners make a living in the animal sales business, the cereal sales business, the grocery store business, and the livestock business.
The partner thanks those who are part of this dream through this means and she promises to follow through with the repayment of her loan according to the established plan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número  2 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé. Las 17 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
Carmen, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de leche, comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, ya que debe dejar su producto para la hora del desayuno de los clientes. Se ha formado una buena cantidad de clientela, es por ello que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de leche, ya que ello le ayudara a poder cumplir con sus clientes y también generar los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Luchadores” [Fighting Women] is in its second cycle with the Women’s Communal Bank Program, which is located in the city of Caacupé.  The 17 members of the communal bank work very hard to be able to get ahead, along with their families. 

Carmen, one of the members, sells milk.  She says that she starts working very early every day, as she must drop off her product in time for her customers’ breakfasts. She has gained a good number of customers, which is why things are going well for her.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of milk, as this will help her to be able to meet her customers’ demands and generate income to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of milk to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. Luciana is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Luciana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Luciana has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Ulmaskhon

texts.ru: Улмасхон, 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. В настоящее время занимается животноводством, полеводством и торговлей фруктами, в бизнесе помогает муж. Улмасхон с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 0,28 Га земли, выращивает картофель и огурцы, в хозяйстве есть 2 овцы.
