Caridad, a 71-year-old married mother of eleven, works very hard to provide for her family. For 40 years Caridad has run a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, coffee, condiments, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, condiments and other groceries.

In the future, Caridad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 13 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Luyến operates a food stall/restaurant selling cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk. She is applying for a loan to purchase more of these items to resell.

Luyến is 31 years old and she is married with two children.
She is the leader of a seven member group, the Nhóm 01 Thôn 13 Quảng Lưu solidarity group.
Luyến lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Luyến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Luyến has been involved in the food stall business for nine years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit Luyến hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a farmer from Mahayag who grows various commodities. She is requesting a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. 

Marivic hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
She may be small when it comes to size, but she proves that she could do her thing well in entrepreneurship. Lucia is a typical mother and a micro-entrepreneur from Pasay City. She is an active borrower of CCT and she faithfully repaid her previous loans. The loans helped her to improve not only her business but also her family's lives and finances.

Lucia is asking again ever generous Kiva lenders for a PHP 25,000 in financial assistance. This new loan will go towards additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages which she will need to expand her variety store. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could continue to provide for her family's needs through this additional capital.

Lucia dreams one day of being a manager and owner of a bigger grocery store. She also desires to have her own mansion someday. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rachell

texts.en:
Rachell is 37 years old and has a farm in Mahayag. She and her husband grow rice and corn. For this cropping season, she applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost.

In the future, Rachell hopes to double her produce so that she can support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel has big dreams for her family. Married at an early age, she and her husband see to it that they can provide well for their children.

Liezel cultivates their land in Mahayag and slowly expanded their farming activities by growing various commodities. Now, she needs additional capitalization. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer.

In the future, Liezel wants to purchase a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is 48-years-old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Clotilde runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries.

Clotilde has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Clotilde would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mercy Adriana

texts.es: A sus 18 años de edad Adriana tiene un hijo de un año de edad. Adriana  vive en el campo y se dedica a la crianza y comerciaizacion de animales. Adriana vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y su hijo, Adriana solicita el credito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos ya que tiene 2 años de experiencia en el cuidado estos animales, Adriana tiene chancheras para criar los chanchos pero en la actualidad no tiene ninguno. Adriana cuenta que ella es padre y madre para su hijo ya que el padre del niño le niega como hijo, Adriana va  a sacar adelante a su hijo mediante los ingresos que le deje su negocio.
texts.en:
Adriana is eighteen years old and has a one-year-old boy. She lives in the country and works raising and selling animals. Adriana lives in her parents' house, with them and her son. 

Adriana is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing pigs, since she already has two years of experience taking care of these animals. She has pens for raising them, but she currently doesn't have any pigs.

Adriana says she is both father and mother to her son, because her child's father denies he is his. Adriana is going to use the income she makes from her business to provide for her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 29 years old with five children. With three of her children in school, Arlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Arlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries.

Arlyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, oil, shampoo, candles, condiments and other groceries.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia es una mujer muy trabajadora y que prioriza las necesidades de su familia, ella tiene 34 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 2 y 17 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lucrecia con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como empleada doméstica, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace seis años, pero también vende crema y queso en las calles de su comunidad, gracias a estas dos actividades logra muy buen ingreso.
Lucrecia ahora ha pensado en remodelar el techo de su casa y construir un cuarto, pero ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, por tal motivo solicita un crédito que lo utilizar para comprar laminas, blocks, arena y hierro.

Lucrecia tiene el anhelo de construir una casa para cada uno de sus hijos  y que sean grandes  profesionales para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a very hard-working woman who puts the needs of her family first. She is 34 and has a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 2 and 17. They live in a community in Sololá.

In her desire to generate income and carry her family forward, Lucrecia works as a housekeeper. She has been doing this for six years, but she also sells cream and cheese in the streets of the community in which she lives. Thanks to these two jobs she makes a good income. 

Lucrecia would now like to remodel the roof of her house and build another room, but she does not have sufficient money. This is why she is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy metal sheets, building blocks, sand and iron. 

Lucrecia's dreams are to build a house for each of her children, and for them to be great professionals so that they will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, building blocks, sand and iron

loans.name: Khemsao

texts.en: Khemsao, 39, is a married mother of two children, who lives in Kampong Thom province. The sources of her family’s income are from selling rice and grocery items for twelve years and she could earn about USD 33.00 per day to support her family’s living. This is the fourth loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She decided to apply for this loan in order to pay for school fees and also buy studying tools. She hopes that she can earn more money to support her children’s studying until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy studying tools

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en: Roun is 45 years old, a mother of seven children and five among them are dependent children. The family is living in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. The only source of her family’s income is from rice farming, which she has done for more than five years. She can earn around 52,000 KHR per day. This is the second loan from Kiva's partner VisionFund for her three member group. The past loans helped Roun to have better living conditions. Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan with a portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for plowing fees. Roun hopes that she could earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide loans and career services for the lowest-income students in Mexico.

loans.name: Cheb

texts.en:
Cheb, 51, is a married mother of two children and one of them is in school. She lives in Kampong Cham province. The source of her family’s income is from rice farming 1.5 Hectares of land and from and factory work as an additional income. She has been involved in this business for eighteen years and can earn about USD 12.00 per day.

She is now applying for her first Kiva loan through VisionFund to buy a motorbike to support her current business. Through this loan, she hopes she could earn more money and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to support her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La señora Irene tiene 61 años de edad y vive con un hijo que depende de ella en la zona provincial de Cochabamba. La señora, que enviudó hace tres años, es una persona trabajadora, humilde y responsable, pero de bajos recursos económicos. Actualmente se dedica a la producción agrícola, la cual le genera ingresos económicos esporádicos por la venta estacional a lo largo del año. La señora Irene realiza sus siembras en terrenos heredados de sus padres. Ella necesita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas, particularmente abono orgánico (conocido como gallinaza) más semilla de papa, porque quiere aprovechar los precios bajos de la temporada ya que sus cultivos todavía no han alcanzado una calidad óptima para ser cosechados. La señora Irene piensa mejorar su situación económica por medio de los ingresos que tendrá en la siguiente campaña agrícola, de esta forma también lograra mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Irene is 61 years old and lives with her son (who is a dependent) in the provincial area of Cochabamba. She became a widow three years ago; however, Irene is extremely hardworking, humble, and responsible despite her low income.

She makes a living in agricultural production, which generates sporadic income depending on the selling season for the majority of the year. She grows her crops on land that she inherited from her parents. She is asking for a loan in order to buy agricultural inputs, particularly organic fertilizer (known as gallinaza), and more potato seeds, because she wants to take advantage of the currently low prices. Her current crops have not quite reached their optimum quality to harvest.

Irene wants to improve her economic situation with an income from next year's crops. She believes that through this, she will also be able to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, organic fertilizer, and potato seeds in order to take advantage of low prices and increase production.

loans.name: Superlita

texts.en:
Superlita lives in Mahayag and cultivates a farm that grows rice and corn.

She has accessed several loans without records of default. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer.

Superlita hopes that she can send all her children to school and would love to have savings for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
Edelyn, a 38-year-old woman, is a hard working entrepreneur from Baseco, Manila. Francis, her husband, works as a fish vendor also. Together, they work hard to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Edelyn buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Edelyn is requesting PHP 50,000 in loan assistance to continue operation of her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish and she desires for her children to finish schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish which are necessary to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 31 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Vivian works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods and personal care products.

Vivian has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products for her general store.

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es:
Laura, con 23 años de edad es soltera.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercancía y productos por catálogo, ofrece cosméticos, accesorios, ropa, perfumes, entre otros y con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar durante el tiempo que lleva realizando dicha actividad. 

Es una mujer emprendedora, con visión, dedicada y comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, siempre busca oportunidades que le permitan progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir los productos que vende.

De esta manera, Laura podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo primordial, que es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Laura is 23 years old and single. She currently works selling merchandise and products by catalog. She offers cosmetics, accessories, clothing, fragrances, and other items. Ever since she started this business, it has allowed her to have enough resources to contribute to her household income.

She is an enterprising woman. She has a lot of vision, and she is dedicated and committed to her family and her work. She is always looking for opportunities that might allow her to move forward. That is why she is requesting a loan. She wants to invest in purchasing a display case to exhibit the products she sells.

This will allow Laura to work towards meeting her main goal, which is to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a display case for her products.

loans.name: Carlos Amilcar

texts.es:
Carlos, de 33 años de edad, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus hijos, su esposa es ama de casa y sus hijos estudian.

Carlos, tiene una pequeña panadería desde hace varios años, se dedica a la elaboración y a la venta de pan junto a su familia.

Carlos, necesita el crédito para ampliar un poco más su panadería, considera que ya es necesario contratar más personal y aumentar su producción, pues la demanda a crecido.

Carlos, sueña con prosperar en su panadería y convertirse en un distribuidor mayorista en el Oriente del país y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old,  is married and lives with his wife and children. His wife is a homemaker and his children attend school. Carlos has had a small bakery for several years now. He makes and sells bread with his family. 

Carlos needs the loan to expand his bakery. He considers it is necessary to hire more employees and to increase his production because the demand has grown. Carlos dreams of being successful with his bakery and to become a wholesale distributor in the eastern area of the country and this way, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to expand his bakery a little more.

loans.name: Luz Odilia

texts.es:
Luz, de 56 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de chigorodo, en este negocio vende pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Luz trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos. 

Enfrenta múltiples dificultades como el costo de los insumos, la competencia en el sector y las fuertes lluvias que azotan su puesto de trabajo.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is 56 years old and decided to open a food stall near her home, located in the town of Chigorodo. Her business sells chicken pies, empanadas, buñuelos, and other items. Luz works every day from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm. She is a very responsible and sensible woman, and she is very dedicated to her business. 

One of her greatest dreams is to be able to have a restaurant where she could offer different types of food and create jobs. She faces multiple difficulties such as the cost of supplies, the competition within the neighborhood, and the heavy rain that batters her stall.

She is asking for financial help in order to capitalize her business. She will use this loan to buy ingredients like chicken, oil, flour, and other items. This loan will have a very positive impact on her life and her business, because it will allow her to be able to achieve her dream and she will have a wider variety of food to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken, oil, and flour.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 42 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Shabana has been running her own beauty salon for the past 8 years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business. Therefore Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance .

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 35 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 2 children. Her husband has been running his electric store for the past 12 years. Her husband is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Ghazala's husband has to purchase electric merchandise e.g wires, cables, tube lights, plug shoes, and other electric devices but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Ghazala has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandise as per his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items such as wires, cables, tube lights, plug shoes, and other devices for her husband's electrical business.

loans.name: Sokorm

texts.en:
Sokorm, 20, is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwest Cambodia. She lives in a wooden one-floor house with her parents and younger sister. Her family owns two hectares of rice fields. 

In May 2014, Sokorm received training from Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for female empowerment by training and offering women sustainable work in the village. Sokorm learned to makes scarves, which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her income to pay for her own expenses and help her mother buy fertilizer for the field.  

Sokorm will use the loan to buy silk and pay for dyeing and loom-related expenses. Please support Sokorm so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for weaving expenses

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a businesswoman from Mahayag. She owns a farm where she grows various commodities. She delivers her produce to nearby towns. She wants to take advantage of good sales. She wants to plant more, so that she will earn more. 

Norma applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. In the future, she wants to own a stall in the market for display of her produce.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Rosalba, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sabaneta, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante.
Trabaja con 3 empleados todos los días durante 13 horas.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.
Rosalba ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas y un congelador para almacenar sus ingredientes.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Rosalba is a humble and hardworking woman. She is a fighter, and she has dedicated most of her life to taking care of her children. She lives in the town of Sabaneta, where she makes a living preparing a variety of food, like lunches and breakfasts, at a small restaurant. She works a thirteen-hour workday alongside three employees every day.

Her food is well known in the neighborhood. Locals come to her restaurant because they know they will enjoy a delicious meal. Rosalba has decided to improve her business and increase sales. That is why she has turned to a loan in order to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes and a freezer to store her ingredients.

This loan will allow her to keep her business going and obtain the income she needs in order to continue supporting her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams come true!

loans.use: to buy ingredients, supplies, and a freezer.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita would like you to know her full appreciation and thanksgiving because her previous loan helped her to buy additional products for her business inventory. She faithfully repaid the PHP 25,000 loan. 

Now she would like to improve her sales even more. Therefore, she is humbly requesting another PHP 30,000, which she will utilize to purchase more merchandise to sell. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. 

At some time at the future, she wants to invest in a house and a car. She also aspires to have her own stall and be able to earn for her children's education. If they finish their studies someday, it will be a great security for better lives ahead. She meets every week with her fellowship group* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las durante 15 horas con 1 empleado.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar, queso, levadura, entre otros, para mejorar su capacidad de producción y poder incrementar su oferta de deliciosos alimentos.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada teniendo en mente siempre a Interactuar y a Kiva como grandes aliados en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Daniela has lots of baking experience. She started her own bakery some time ago, and so far it has yielded very good results. She has always preferred working for herself. She works a fifteen-hour workday alongside one employee every day.

She currently needs some help in order to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cheese, baking powder, and other items, in order to increase her production capacity and the variety of delicious food items she offers. This loan will allow her to have better working conditions and to ensure the quality of her preparations.

Her greatest dream is being able to improve her housing conditions.

Thanks to this support, Daniela will be better organized to work. And as she works, she will always keep Interactuar and Kiva in mind. They are the greatest allies of her production process.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cheese, and baking powder.

loans.name: Joaquín Humberto

texts.es:
Joaquín, de 61 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor, solo logró estudiar hasta segundo siclo de educación básica, actualmente está casado y tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con él, ya que está estudiando bachillerato.

Joaquín, trabaja como agricultor desde que tenía quince años de edad, actualmente realiza dos actividades las cuales consisten en la crianza ganado de repasto y también cultiva maíz. 

Joaquín, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra en donde trabajará.

El sueño que tiene, es poder trabajar sus cultivos, sin preocuparse de la situación económica.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 61 years old and works as a farmer. He was only able to get the equivalent of a junior high school education. He is currently married and has five children. Only one of them still lives with him because he is in high school. Joaquín has been a farmer since he was fifteen years old. He currently has two businesses, since he both raises beef cattle and grows corn.

Joaquín needs this loan in order to buy farm supplies and to pay for rent on the land he will be using. His goal is to be able to work on his crops without worrying about his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay rent on the land he will use.

loans.name: Pheat's Group

texts.en: A mother of three dependent children living in Kampong Thom province, Pheat is 45 years old. For her family, she grows rice and works for another farm to earn more income. Her group consists of five members, and this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to build a private toilet for her family. She hopes to improve her family's living condition and that all of her family members will have good health.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a responsible mother of four children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband, who is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family, has been driving a taxi for twenty-five years.  The taxi he drives is in need of maintenance as it is in bad condition and needs constant work. However, Suriya's husband does not have the financial means to pay for the repairs. Therefore, Suriya is requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Suriya's husband can easily afford the maintenance cost. The repairs will allow him to provide better transport facilities and earn more income. Suriya plans to save some of the profits to meet her family's future needs. Suriya is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: pay for repairs to her husband's taxi

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru: Нурмахмад молодой предприниматель района Рудаки, работающий в городе Душанбе в одном из крупных рынках. Она живет вместе с женой, детьми и родителями. Нурмахмад на рынке продает большие национальные деревянные тарелки, деревянные корзинки, музыкальные инструменты выполненные только из дерева и другие деревянные товары. Ему нравится, то чем она занимается и любит свою работу. Нурмахмад хочет расширить свою деятельность увеличить ассортимент товара и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. С такими намерениями он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Nurmahmad is a young entrepreneur from the Rudaki district.  He works in one of the major markets of the city of Dushanbe.  He lives with his wife, children and parents. At the market, Nurmahmad sells large traditional wooden plates, wooden baskets, musical instruments entirely made of wood, and other goods also made from wood.  His enjoys his activity and loves his work. Nurmahmad wants to increase his activity and expand his selection of goods in order to attract more customers.  With this goal in mind, he is taking a loan.

loans.use: to increase his selection of goods.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида жизнелюбивая, вежливая и полна энергии женщина из города Душанбе. Она молодая женщина предпринимательница и мать одиночка. Ей 31 год. Ее 13 летний сын для нее стимул в жизни. Ради своего ребенка она живет и работает. Саида имеет салон свадебных платьев. Она сама обслуживает клиентов и помогает сделать им правильный выбор. Саида  обожает свою работу. Ей всегда нравиться наблюдать за восторженными лицами невест. Она надеется, что продолжить свой бизнес и сейчас, когда в стране экономический кризис Саида надеется удержать бизнес. Она хочет привлечь клиентов и больше внимание уделяет маркетинговой части бизнес. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить баннеры и рекламные щиты. Она верит, что таким образом она привлечет клиентов и не потеряет бизнес.
texts.en:
Saida is an active, polite and dynamic woman from the city of Dushanbe.  At age 31, she is a young entrepreneur and a single mother.  Her 13-year-old son is her motivation in life, and it is for him that she keeps on going and working. Saida owns a bridal shop.  She serves her customers herself and helps them to make the right choice.  Saida loves her work.  She is always happy to see the excitement on the future brides' faces.  

Saida is hoping to continue her business, even though the country is going through an economic crisis.  She wants to keep her activity, attract customers and pay a greater attention to the marketing part of her business.  She is taking a loan to buy banners and billboards.  She believes that in doing so, she will be able to attract customers and avoid losing her activity.

loans.use: to buy banners and billboards to attract customers.

loans.name: Saeb

texts.en:
Saeb is a 19-year-old single man from Dier El Balah City. He lives with his family in a small house. His mother is an employee in a supermarket where she earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Saeb is a student in the university where he studies Media and press. He wants to complete his degree and find a job in order to improve the family's living conditions.

Saeb took a  USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.  By taking this loan, Saeb will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Saeb appears in the photo with his new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 30-year-old married man from Rafah City. He lives with his wife and two kids in a small house. He is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. Basel is also a student in the university where he studies Social Science. He wants to complete his degree and find a better job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Basel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Basel will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Basel appears in the photo with his new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a strong-willed and hardworking woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is both a hands-on businesswoman and a mother who never gets tired of working and supporting her family. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed and pay for construction materials to repair and expand her pig pens. 

One day Belen hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town and venture into a little restaurant business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and pay for construction materials to repair and expand her pig pens.

loans.name: Meludina

texts.en:
Here is Meludina, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Recently, she had a loan worth PHP 40,000, which she used for her direct selling business within their vicinity. Actually, she sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. This is why she would like to give her gratitude to those who lent her assistance previously. 

To improve sales, Meludina would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional products to sell, like accessories, bags, and similar items. With PHP 30,000, she can certainly improve her livelihood and eventually grow her business with the grace of God. For now, it is her desire to have people like you assisting her in her enterprise. 

In the future, Meludina hopes to give her family a more favorable kind of living and simultaneously drive her inventory into progress. She meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed to restock her direct sales business.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn 1 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Hà, 41, is married with three children and lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past ten years she has sold cassettes and CDs to earn an income. She is also the leader of the three-member Nhóm 09 Thôn 1 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which is pictured in this photograph.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Hà in regard to her media business is her lack of capital. Therefore she is applying for a 30,000,000 VND loan through Kiva’s partner Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to be divided among her group. This will be her first loan, and she will use it to buy more cassettes and CDs to sell.

With her profits Hà hopes to build a new house, for her business thrive and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy more cassettes and CDs to sell.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children who attend school. Due to difficult economic conditions, Amal is obliged to work continually, as she is responsible for supporting her husband with their family expenses. 
Amal opened a clothing shop since 2008 where she sells scarfs and clothes. She provides her customers with good quality products. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, although she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living even more. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase merchandise and to renovate the shop. In the future, she plans to borrow additional loans with the aim of developing her work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and to renovate the shop.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
For years now, Dolores has been operating her sari-sari store together with her husband, Roger. Their income from business and work helps them to survive every day’s needs and expenses. 

Having faithfully paid back her previous loan amounting to PHP 17 000, she would respectfully like to avail another loan worth PHP 20,000 which she will use to purchase more grocery items like shampoo, biscuits, condiments and other relative products. Surely, this will help her improve her profit at no given time. By now, she sincerely lets you know her thanksgiving for your deep rooted generosity and kindness. 

Someday, Dolores dreams of being successful with the current inventory. Through this she'll be able to earn for a brighter future ahead. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 35 years old with two children ages eight and five years old. She and her husband rise around 5:00 a.m. to buy wholesale crackers and seasonings such as garlic and pepper to be repackaged and sold. While she repacks the crackers, her husband roams their community selling the crackers, which gains them a net of 500 PHP daily.

Last year a crisis hit when their house, together with other houses in their area, was demolished for a mall’s construction. Their resettlement necessitated buying land that they are now paying off.

But instead of losing hope and will, they have redoubled their efforts selling their products in the marketplace. Their hard work has gained them loyal customers who order their products in bulk, which has increased their income to 800-1,000 PHP daily.

Ligaya wants to expand her business because more customers now are putting in bulk orders for their repackaged crackers and seasonings. She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through Kiva’s partner SEED Center Philippines to buy 25 bags of fish crackers, 25 bags of pork crackers, two kilos of peppercorns and ten sacks of garlic to be repackaged and sold at retail.

Ligaya wants to save for her children's education and build a home for them to start again.

loans.use: to buy 25 bags of fish crackers, 25 bags of pork crackers, two kilos of peppercorns and ten sacks of garlic

loans.name: Dauy's Group

texts.en: Dauy’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Dauy makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 50-year-old woman, and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, her husband sells fruits, e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Shamim's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that her husband can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.  Therefore, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his fruit business

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 45 лет, вдова, живет с сыном и его семьей. У Элмиры среднее образование, она работает санитаром в центре семейной медицины, также занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Элмиры есть 1 лошадь, 3 коровы. Сын летом работает пастухом. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Элмиры составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. Поэтому Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Элмира планирует увеличить свою прибыль и в дальнейшем продолжать развивать бизнес.
texts.en: Elmira is 45 years old, a widow, and she lives with her son and his family.  She has a secondary education and she works as an orderly in a center for family medicine.  She is also involved in animal husbandry.  She currently has one horse and three cows on her farm.  In the summer, her son works as a shepherd.  Elmira makes a total monthly income of about 9,000 som (KGS), which is vastly insufficient for a decent life.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows.  Elmira is planning to increase her income and to keep on growing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a smallholder farmer who has really diversified his practice. He lives in Tinderet village, situated in the North Rift region of Kenya. He has a lovely wife named Judith and two children. Ezekiel started farming on a 10-acre farm in 2009. He has grown the farm operation and diversified its product portfolio. The 26-year-old farmer has also employed one permanent employee to help him run the farm. 

Ezekiel is a dairy farmer, a poultry farmer and a cereal business owner. Ezekiel is seeking a loan for restocking his cereal store and purchasing animal feed. He buys cereals from fellow farmers and sells them to consumers far away from the reach of farmers. This business helps him make a living off facilitating trade. 

In order for him to expand this business, he needs money to purchase more cereals from the farmers. With your money, Ezekiel is also going to purchase feeds for his livestock. Currently, he is heavily relying on the grass growing in the paddock. To make his livestock grow healthy and productive, he needs to mix the available feed with manufactured feed that has more nutrients and salts. Money generated from this investment will enable Ezekiel to repay his loan and provide enough food for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and animal feeds

loans.name: Sergio Leon

texts.es:
Sergio, con 49 años de edad es padre de 1 hija y es casado.

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercancía y productos por catálogo, ofrece cosméticos, accesorios, perfumes, entre otros y con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar durante los tres años que lleva realizando dicha actividad. 

Es un hombre emprendedor, con visión, dedicado y comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, siempre busca oportunidades que le permitan progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor como perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, shampoo, tratamientos capilares para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan y ofrecer más variedad que satisfaga los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y así poder tener mejor margen de utilidad por las ventas. 

De esta manera, Sergio podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo primordial, que es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, brindándoles una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Sergio is 49 years old, is the father of one daughter and is married. Currently, he sells merchandise and products by catalog. He offers cosmetics, accessories, perfumes, among others. He has managed to obtain the resources to support his household during the 3 years that he has done this type of work. 

He is an entrepreneur with a vision, dedicated and committed to his family and his work. He is always looking for opportunities that will allow him to advance. For this reason, he is requesting the loan, with the purpose of investing in the purchase of merchandise in bulk such as perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics, shampoo, hair treatments, to take advantage of the discounts and to offer a greater variety to satisfy the preferences and needs of his customers. As a result, he will be able to obtain a better margin from the sales. Consequently, Sergio would get closer to achieving his main objective, which is to expand his business and improve the quality of life of his family, providing them with financial stability.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk, such as, perfumes, body lotions, beauty products, shampoo, hair treatments.

loans.name: Itzel Adriana

texts.en: Itzel is 32 years old and unmarried. Fearless and persevering in business at age 20, when she was studying in a state college, she started a computer services and internet business. Today, in addition to her business, Itzel is part of an association of psychoanalysis to teach and to give therapy. Itzel plans on growing her business further and she is requesting a loan of MXN 12,000 to complement her business with a cybercafé in order to increase her income. She needs to purchase materials and the proper equipment to adapt the space so she can serve food and beverages. Itzel is a very loyal woman and appreciates the support of her friends and investors, so she will be very grateful to the people who support her business to keep growing. Her dreams are reflected in the effort she puts forth as an entrepreneur and will make successful repayments on her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials in order to expand the business into a cyber cafe.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia joined Paglaum in the year 2008. She wanted to gain coop benefits like insurance and access to financial assistance. She availed several loans already and never missed a single payment. Adelia has maintained a good record with the Cooperative, so that she can always apply for her capitalization. 

Now, she applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. She hopes that she will be blessed with good produce, so that she will have enough savings for her children's educational needs

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Fazilamoh

texts.ru: Это женщина Фазиламох. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. У нее 2 сыновей и 2 дочери. Фазиламох вместе семьей живет на районе Хамадони. Мужу 38 лет. Он на районе сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Он во дворе выращивает скота. Сама Фазиламох занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает пшеницу. Эту деятельности ей научили родители. Она уже 4 года идет по их стопам. Фазиламох сейчас хочет обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получит богатый урожай. Для приобретения минеральных удобрений у нее нет денег, по этой причине Фазиламох просит кредит.
texts.en: Fazilamoh is 35 years old and the married mother of four children (two sons and two daughters).  She and her family live in the Hamadoni district.  Her husband is 38 years old and involved in agriculture, in the district.  He also raises livestock at home.  Fazilamoh herself grows crops, particularly wheat.  She learned this activity from her parents and has been following in their footsteps for four years already.  Fazilamoh now wants to prepare her land with mineral fertilizers, so that she can get an abundant harvest.  However, she doesn't have the money to buy mineral fertilizers, and is therefore taking a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and use them to prepare the land.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 49 años de edad, vive en casa de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe. región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos así como alimento para el engorde de estos, con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Esteban is 49 years old and lives in a house made of rustic materials with his spouse and his son in the Cañaris district. The people in this community work in agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Ferreñafe, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. He earns a living raising pigs and has done this for 10 years. Therefore, he has experience in this business and has good personal and work references in the district.

He will use the loan to buy more pigs as well as food to fatten them. With this he hopes to grow his business which will generate more income to allow him to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs as well as food to fatten them.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking female entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a bakery in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marissa dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to provide for and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: La Victoire A Group

texts.fr: Francine est commerçante, conseillère de la banque communautaire «La Victoire A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, adulte, divorcée, mère de 3 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son ancien mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais sur la rue dans une avenue mouvementée de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en 26kg de poissons. Elle souhaite construire une maison, augmenter ses activités, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Francine is a merchant and the advisor of the community bank “La Victoire A”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is an adult, divorced, and the mother of three children, who are all students. She started her business with funds from her former husband. She is a street vendor of fresh fish on a busy avenue in town. Francine is going to supply herself with 26 kg of fish. She would like to build a house, increase her business, and provide schooling and food for her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice and beans to cook and sell in his restaurant, so as to earn more

loans.name: La Victoire B Group

texts.fr: Faida est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «La Victoire B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 26 ans, mère 3 enfants dont 2 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Elle est vendeuse des fruits sur la route dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va acheter des ananas, oranges, papayes, bananes, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Faida is a merchant and member of the loan group “La Victoire B”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 26 years old, and the mother of three children, of whom two are students and one is still very young. She started her business with funds from her relatives. Faida has been a street vendor of fruit on a busy avenue in town since she was young. She is going to supply herself with pineapples, oranges, papayas, bananas, etc. She would like to increase her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase pineapples, oranges, papayas, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Gulaym

texts.ru: Гулайм 51 год, не замужем, мать 4 детей. В 2000 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. Среднемесячный доход Гулайм составляет до 10,000 сом (KGS). Гулайм обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита позволят ей улучшить ее благосостояние и развить бизнес.
texts.en: Gulaym is 51 years old, single, and the mother of four children.  In 2000 she started her own animal husbandry business.  She currently has three cows on her farm.  She makes an average monthly income of up to 10,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 15,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to improve her well-being and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 75 sacks of cement.

loans.name: Buaysha

texts.ru: Буайша, 59 лет, замужем, она мать 2 детей. У Буайши среднее образование, она на пенсии, на протяжении 36 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. В хозяйстве Буайши есть 3 коровы и 22 овцы. На участке мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает пшеницу и рис. Ежемесячная прибыль Буайши составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) с целью развития ее бизнеса, а именно, на запрошенную сумму Буайша планирует приобрести нетель. Доходы от кредита Буайша будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Buaysha is 59 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education and is now retired.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming for the past 36 years.  She currently has three cows and 22 sheep on her farm.  She also grows wheat and rice on two hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  Eager to grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy one heifer.  Buaysha will reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Yasser Alejandro

texts.es:
En la música encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Yasser que a sus 37 años es un hombre con gran talento y pasión por este arte.
Toca varios instrumentos musicales, pero su verdadera pasión es la producción musical. Tiene un pequeño estudio en el cual ha producido muchos sonidos.
Es un negocio único en su zona y es por esto que es un lugar especial.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar una ampliación locativa en su estudio el cual comparte con otras dos personas profesionales en la materia musical, el cual le permitirá continuar con su trabajo con el cual ha intentado obtener algunos ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus estudios en música y aportar con la economía de su hogar.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de capital para este trabajo, pero poco a poco intentara tener una vida mejor.

Apoya a Yasser con su arte y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Many people find an opportunity to progress and get ahead through music, doing so in a brave and humble way. This was the case for Yasser, 37, who has a great talent and passion for this art. He plays various musical instruments, but his true passion is music production. He has a small studio where he has produced many songs. In the area where he lives his business is unique, and for this reason it is a truly special place. 

Yasser is requesting financial assistance in order to extend his studio which he shares with two other music professionals. This would allow him to continue with his work which he has been using to try and earn some money to keep studying music and to help with household costs. 

One of the biggest difficulties that Yasser has had to face has been the lack of resources for this work, but bit by bit he will try to carve a better future for himself. 

Help Yasser with his art and make his life better with a loan.

loans.use: to extend his recording  studio.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Luz montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus hijos. 

La actividad la aprendió a través de las enseñanzas de una amiga Y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 

Con sus trabajos, Luz ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Luz busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de tela y a realizar el mantenimiento de sus maquinas de confección.

Luz espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 

Además, Luz espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Luz began her clothing workshop with the aim of generating income with which she could sustain her home, where she lives with her children, economically. She learned her activity through her friend’s teaching, which has allowed her to perform good quality work in a timely manner. 

Luz has attracted a large number of customers and has secured very good monthly sales. She expects that her business will continue to grow and that she can generate employment for those most in need.

In order to meet customer demand, Luz seeks a loan to give her the ability to purchase cloth and perform maintenance on her sewing machine. Luz hopes that her family can enjoy a better income which will allow them to have a better quality of life and a better quality education.

Luz expects her business to continue to grow at a good pace. Moreover, she can generate at least one job in her workshop for a person who has no job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cocinando hasta cumplir.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como arepas, hamburguesas y chuzos de carne de cerdo en un carro de comidas.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente desde que su esposo falleció.

Sus mayores dificultades son la competencia del sector, el costo de los insumos y su incapacidad para permanecer mucho tiempo de pie.

Beatriz solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos e ingredientes como carne, pan, salsas, entre otros para aumentar su producción y tener el capital suficiente para continuar trabajando

Con tu ayuda Beatriz Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Beatriz is a very enterprising and tenacious woman with big dreams that she is working in order to realize. 

She has a small business making and selling foods like areas, burgers, and pork chuzos in a food cart. She attempts to earn a living daily to improve the lives of her family of two children who are her reason for living and her motivation to work hard everyday since her husband passed away. 

Her greatest difficulties are competition in her industry, the cost of ingredients, and her inability to remain standing for long periods of time. Beatriz is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies and ingredients such as meat, bread, sauces, and more to increase her production and have sufficient capital to continue working. 

With your help, Beatriz can afford education for her children, which is one of her greatest dreams!

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en: Thida, 32, is a married mother of two dependent children and she is a villager of Keo Seima district, Mondulkiri province. The source of her family’s income is from potato farming on five hectares farmland for six years and to earn more income, she also sells grocery items as well. She is now applying for a second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, as a group of five. She will use her portion to buy farming supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she could earn more income and have enough consumption to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
Veasna, 28, is a villager of Keo Seima district, Mondulkiri province. The source of his income has been from potato farming for nine years and to earn more income, he works for other farms as well. He can earn around 57,000 KHR per day through his business. 

He is now applying for his first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, as a group of three. He will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farming. He hopes that he can earn more income and have enough consumption to support his living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en:
Born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1995, Rukhshona is an active girl. She lives in a small city with her family and is a third-year student at university. studying International Economic Relations part time. 

Rukhshona is an active student in classes and well known among students and friends. Communicative, responsible, gentle and hospitable, she tries to study with excellence in order to find good work in her specialty. 

Rukhshona's parents are workers, and their savings are not enough to pay her tuition fees. She is therefore requesting a loan from KIVA to help pay her higher education costs.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs

loans.name: Kelly Martha

texts.es:
La socia Kelly Martha se dedica al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, la socia vende parabrisas, llantas y ventanas para carros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de repuestos de carros. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar parabrisas, llantas y ventanas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Kelly Martha makes a living in the business of selling car parts. She sells window-shields, tires, and windows for cars. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. She wants to succeed in her business. Her dream is to grow her business of selling car parts. She is requesting a loan to buy window-shields, tires, and windows.

She is happy for this loan and promises to make her payments as required.

loans.use: to purchase window-shields, tires, and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many pairs of shoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a lot of jewelry to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Neftali Armando

texts.es:
Neftalí, de 71 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor, no tiene ningún grado académico, actualmente vive solo con su nieta, ya que sus dos hijos no viven junto a él.

Neftalí, trabaja como agricultor, trabaja desde que es muy joven, actualmente trabaja dos hectáreas de maíz y una hectárea de frijol, también trabaja comprando ganado para repastar y criarlo y cuando está gordo lo vende y de esta manera obtiene algunos ingresos.
	
Neftalí, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas, porque el invierno está cerca y la tierra ya casi esta lista para empezar a prepárala.

Su objetivo principal es lograr obtener una buena cosecha y sabe que lo puede lograr con el financiamiento de su crédito.
texts.en:
Neftalí, 71, works as a farmer. He has no education and lives alone with his granddaughter. He has two children who does not live with him.

Neftalí has worked as a farmer since he was very young. He currently has two acres of corn and beans that he works. He also works buying cattle to raise and resell when fattened to earn some income.

Neftalí needs money to purchase farm inputs because winter is near and it is almost time to begin to prepare the land. His main goal is to get a good harvest, which he knows he can accomplish with a loan.

loans.use: to prepare his fields for planting corn and beans

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, de 49 años, inicio con un negocio de venta de mercancía y alquiler de lavadoras hace aproximadamente 8 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir sostenerse.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus padres por los cual actualmente responde económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una lavadora nueva la cual le permitirá cubrir una mayor cantidad de servicios.

Este servicio es muy utilizado por las personas de la región de Turbo, que en muchos casos no tienen como lavar su ropa de manera adecuada.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y mejorarlo. Apoya a Edgar para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en: Edgar is 49 years ago. Approximately 8 years ago, he started a business selling merchandise and renting washing machines with the purpose of looking for an activity that would generate income to be able to support himself. Currently, he finds his motivation to work untiringly in his parents, for whom he nowadays responds financially. He is requesting a loan to buy a new washing machine, which will allow him to cover a greater quantity of services. This service is widely used by the people of the Turbo region, who in many cases do not have a way to wash their clothes appropriately. With this loan he will be able to sustain his business and improve it. Support Edgar so he can continue with his activity!

loans.use: to buy a new washing machine which will allow him to cover a greater quantity of services.

loans.name: Wawan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Wawan. Wawan lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. Wawan owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Wawan needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Wawan’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Wawan is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Taufik. Taufik lives in Bekasi, a satellite city located at the east of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Taufik lives there with his wife and his two children (one daughter and one son). He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks and drinks and provides mobile payment services for his community. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he has learned a lot about how to manage his business, as well as learned about how to manage and increase his saving.

As the business grows, Taufik is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Taufik improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Taufik is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Sors' Group

texts.en:
Sors, 39, is a married mother of four children, and two of them are in school. They are living in the Snoul district of Kratie province. The source of her family’s income has been from potato farming for fifteen years, and working for other farms is an additional source of her income. She can earn about 48,000 KHR per day. 

She is now applying for a Kiva loan through VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees for doing farming. Through this loan, she hopes she can earn more money and be able to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Samijo

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Samijo. Samijo lives in Bekasi, a satellite city located at the east of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Samijo lives there with his wife and his two daughters. Together with his wife, he owns a small stall where they sell daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. Samijo is a hardworking guy and his community sees him as trusted mobile provider. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he learned a lot about how to manage his business as well as how to manage and increase his savings.

As the business grows, Samijo is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Samijo improve his business and, accordingly, his community who need access to such services. As seen in the photo, Samijo is the one who is smiling and standing in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones

loans.name: Janefer's Group

texts.en:
Janefer is a 50-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Janefer has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Janefer described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Janefer’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nankoh's Group

texts.fr: Nankoh,  debout  au dernier rang à gauche  sur la photo et portant un tshirt rose près de l'Agent de terrain, est membre d'un groupe de  13 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Sirimambougou, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Nankoh, qui est âgée de 52 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 45 personnes dont 30 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Elle a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour bénéficier de  nouvelles techniques. Pour sa deuxième année avec myAgro, Nankoh a acheté un paquet d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champs de 0.125 hectare. A travers cet achat, Nankoh espère avoir des semences et engrais de qualité envue d’augmenter ses rendements.
texts.en:
Nankoh, standing at the left in the last row and wearing a pink T-shirt near the Land Representative, is a member of a group of thirteen agricultural producers who work and live in the village of Sirimambougou, in the southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 52 years old and lives in a family composed of 45 persons, including 30 children. 

Farming enables Nankoh to ensure her entire family is self-sufficient in food. She decided to sign up with myAgro to benefit from new techniques. For her second years with myAgro, she purchased a packet of fertilizer for growing peanuts in her 0.125 hectare field. Through this purchase, she hopes to have quality seeds and fertilizer with the aim of increasing her yields.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Seji

texts.en: Seji, who carries on the craft of her late husband, Taram, is an artisan from Indonesia, who specializes in hand-carved sculptures. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood. Seji has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story: Balinese artist Taram learned to carve from his brother, and he taught Seji, his wife. Seji now preserves Taram's artistic legacy since he passed away. Taram was inspired by Balinese culture and traditions. "As the son of a master carver, it is easy and enjoyable for me to transfer my imagination into my work," he once said. Always happy and smiling, Taram's carving legacy will be continued by Seji. "He didn't tell us he was seriously ill because he didn't want to make us sad or worry us. He only told me three months before he passed away. We have a young son and an older daughter. They inspire me and motivate me to make sure I can give them a better life, but it has been difficult. I try to fill my day with different activities, working hard. I'll always remember what my husband said before died. He wanted me to carry on caring wisely for our children and he also encouraged me to be a stronger woman for our children's sake. Now I continue his designs, as well as creating my own new designs. "I need some capital to increase my inventory. I am trying to build up stock before the Ngaben ceremony in June. This will keep me occupied and slow down the crafting of new pieces. Thanks for your continued support." Use the link below to view Seji's hand-carved sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/1724

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Kunthea is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 30 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her eight-year-old daughter and her husband. Her family owns four hectares of rice fields. In 2003, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kunthea makes scarves, which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses and to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation and related fees

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
A sus 53 años de edad Ruben logró consolidar un negocio de confección de bolsos gracias a la experiencia que tuvo trabajando con su padre en el negocio de confección que le heredó, trabaja todos los días de la semana durante  8 horas diarias con 1 empleado dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene buen negocio.
