Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas, por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina de confección con la que podrá expandirse a nuevas empresas y tener mejor volumen de trabajo dándole la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller mas competitivo y así un día contar la historia de que gracias a colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At 53, Ruben has established a business making bags. Thanks to his experience working with his father in the manufacturing business, he has inherited this business. He works everyday of the week for 8 hours a day with one employee depending on the amount of work. He knows, thanks to his customers, that he has a good business. 

He wants to expand his horizons and offer employment to those most in need so he is requesting a loan to purchase a clothing machine with which he can expand into a new business and have a better workload to provide an opportunity for a person to work. 

His dream is to continue to grow and form a more competitive workshop so one day he will tell the story that, thanks to the collaborators and lenders on the Kiva website and the Interacturar organization, he was able to create a great business.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to manufacture clothing

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en: Chamroeun, 30, lives in Battambang province and she is a widowed mother of a child. Tailoring has been the only source of her family’s income for 10 years. She could earn about 66,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. She has been with VisionFund for nine cycles already and fully paid back the loans. The previous loan helps her to have a better standard of living. Now she is leading the group of two to apply for this loan with the portion to buy more cloth to support her business. She hopes that she could earn more income and be able to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more cloth

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en: En, 31, lives in Battambang province and she is a married mother of three children. Growing rice has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years and working for other's farms for a fee is an additional income for her. She could earn about 31,000 KHR per day. Now she is leading the group of two to apply for this third loan with her portion used to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she will have enough ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Srey Oun's Group

texts.en: Srey Oun, 31, lives in Battambang province and she is a married mother of four children; two of them are in school. Nowadays, she has grown rice on 5.5 hectares of farmland for 12 years and works for another farm for a fee. She could earn about 38,700 KHR per day. Srey Oun’s group consists of three members, and this is the fifth loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her portion to hire five hectares of farmland for farming. She hopes that she could earn more income and have a better living condition.

loans.use: to hire five hectares of farmland

loans.name: Issa's Group

texts.fr:
Issa qui se trouve au beau milieu sur  la photo , et qui montre sa pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 3agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Momissala au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Issa, âgé de 55 ans, est le père de 5 enfants âgés de 8 à 35ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Issa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 45ans. Issa cultive l'arachide, le maïs, le mil, le sorgho, le sésame sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de bœufs et de matériels agricoles. Issa entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des formations et techniques agricoles  et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année, Issa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 27ans que Issa cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Issa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire du commerce et de faire la transformation du Karité. Enfin ,Issa espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille. 
L'Agent de terrain figure sur la photo.
texts.en:
Issa, appearing right in the middle in the photo and showing his myAgro pouch, is a member of a group of three farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Momissala, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. He is 55 years old and the father of five children, aged 8 to 35, of whom three are currently in school. 

Issa is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, he was encouraged to do this work for 45 years now. He grows peanuts, corn, millet, sorghum, and sesame on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of oxen and of farm supplies. 

Issa is starting his first year with myAgro and signed up because of the training in farming techniques, as well as the conviction shown by the myAgro representatives on the benefits of myAgro methods. This year, he is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn, so as to increase his yields on his 0.5 hectare parcel of land. He has been growing corn for 27 years for its productive and market advantages. 

With greater yields and higher income, Issa is planning on working in commerce and producing shea butter. Ultimately, he also hopes to build a house for his family. The Land Representative appears in the photo

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary, 22, is a married mother of a child who lives in Battambang province. Growing rice is the main source of her family’s income for the past three years, and to earn more income she works for other farmers. Through these businesses, she can earn about 80,000 KHR per day. Her group consists of three members, and this is the first loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a leader, she will use her portion to buy household appliances. She hopes that her house will have enough appliances to use through this loan.

loans.use: to buy household appliances

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer La Confianza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está integrado por cuatro señoras, en su mayoría son familia y vecinas desde hace muchos años, tienen sus actividades productivas en marcha, con bastantes clientes de la comunidad. Ellas iniciaron con ahorros propios y préstamos que solicitan a colombianos de la zona,  decidieron continuar hasta la fecha ya que lograron generar un capital de trabajo. Actualmente requieren apoyo económico para continuar con su ciclo de producción, venta y recuperación.
Una de las integrantes Gema, es madre jefa de hogar, sus dos hijas están en la escuela. Ella cuenta con un bazar que coloco al lado de su casa, es uno de los pocos de la comunidad, donde los vecinos encuentran todo tipo de artículos de librería, regalos, artículos de uso personal, bolsas de regalo y centros de mesa para fiestas,  que confecciona ella misma, ya que asegura posee suficiente habilidad para realizar estos trabajos. 
Gema solicita este crédito para invertir en mercadería nueva para su bazar y compra de materia prima para confeccionar lo que le soliciten. Esto le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y generar ingresos al hogar. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y facilidad en los trámites. En un futuro sueña con tener todo tipo de artículos en su bazar, logar ampliarlo e innovar con venta de ropa en el bazar, llegar a convertirlo en tipo tienda.
texts.en:
This group is composed of four women, most are family and neighbors for many years. They have productive activities underway, with many customers in the area. They started with their own savings. They decided to continue as far as they were able to generate working capital. Currently they require financial support to continue with their production, sale, and recuperation.

One of the members is Gema, mother head of household. Her two daughters are in school. She has a bazaar that she sets out next to her house. It is one of the few in the community, where neighbors can find all types of stationary, gifts, personal items, gift bags, and centerpieces for parties, items she puts together herself, as she has sufficient skill to perform this work.

Gema is asking for a loan to invest in new merchandise for her bazaar and purchase raw materials for making what customers ask for. This will help to increase her sales and generate income for her household. She chose Fundación Mujer because they have low interest rates and the procedure is not difficult.  

In the future she dreams of having all kinds of items in her bazaar, to expand and innovate with selling clothing in her bazaar, and convert to this sort of store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that her customers are asking for.

loans.name: Dayana Mileth

texts.es:
Dayana, a sus 20 años de edad, es una joven carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por el gusto al trabajo independiente.

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante en el poco tiempo que lleva en su negocio.

Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas sola.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.

Dayana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las jóvenes emprendedoras Colombianas!
texts.en:
Dayana, 20, is a charismatic and helpful young woman who works in her own business, a grocery shop. She set up this business as she likes to work independently. Despite adversity, she had the strength and determination to pick herself up and succeed in the short space of time she has been running her business. She also works 10 hours per day, every day by herself. 

Her aim in life is to keep making progress and this is why she wants to boost and establish her business by buying an assortment of products such as groceries, grains, fried goods, fizzy drinks and basic family staples. With these products, she will be able to offer her customers better quality and service, and notably increase her sales and consequently her income. 

Dayana says that her biggest wish is to continue growing her business with assistance from Interactuar, and in the future she hopes to turn it into a supermarket where her customers can find all the items they need. By supporting this loan you will be contributing to the business ventures of young entrepreneurial Colombians!

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products such as groceries, grains,  fried goods, fizzy drinks and general basic family staples.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a married man. He has 10 children. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy carpentry tools. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Mobonu

texts.ru: Мобону 54 летняя жительница района Хамадони. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее 2 сыновей и одна дочка. Старший сын женат и он находится загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Мобону серьезная и ответственная женщина.  Она занимается торговлей на рынке. Мобону продает женские одежды, и свободное время она занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает пшеницу. Ей в работе помогает невестка и младший сын. Мобону хочет купить минеральные удобрения для обработки земли. Минеральные удобрения помогает получить качественный и богатый урожай. Для приобретения достаточного количества минеральных удобрений у нее нет денежных средств, по этой причине Мобону обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Mobonu is a 54-year-old resident of the Hamadoni district. She is married and the mother of three children. She has two sons and one daughter. Her older son is married and lives abroad in order to earn money and help his parents take care of the family. Mobonu is a serious and responsible woman. She sells retail goods at the market. Mobonu sells women’s clothing and plants crops in her free time. She grows wheat. Her daughter-in-law and youngest son help her with the work. Mobonu wants to buy fertilizers to treat the land. Fertilizers help bring in a rich, high-quality harvest. She does not have enough money and this is why she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Navruzbibi

texts.en: Navruzbibi is a skillful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is living in the northern part of the country in a remote district. She is married and has a baby. She is a hardworking, communicative and honest person. After becoming a mother she decided to start her own business. She needed to earn money in order to help her children. She likes to sew and wants to be a tailor and serve the residents of her district. Her husband’s salary is not enough to feed their family. She participated in training provided by IMON and wishes to buy a sewing machine and essential items to start her business activity. She has requested a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine and essential items for sewing. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and essential items for sewing

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, soda, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of soda, milk, bread and other items. His business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of soda, milk, bread and other items

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth and she previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more varieties of grocery items and products for her business. Thank God she already repaid the said amount and her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

This time, she would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to increase the variety of products in her store. Certainly, the more items displayed at the store the better. This will add more profit to her business, and her profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength from studying the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to increase the variety of products in her store.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn recently availed 32,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional quantities and varieties of products needed in her business. As a result, she was able to gain additional profit from the assistance provided. 
She would like to give thanks for those who helped her. 

Now she would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan allowing her to purchase more of personal products for resale like perfumes and related products to add to her current inventory. This will increase her income and her profits from business will definitely help her to support and provide for their family's daily expenses. 

Marlyn simply hopes for her family to be in good condition and health always. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more of personal products to resell

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 23 года, замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Динары, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет 19,500 сом (KGS). Динара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Динара намерена и дальше расширять свой бизнес.
texts.en: Dinara is 23, married and has no children. She has a college education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock. Thanks to her perseverance, dedication and hard work she currently has four cows. Her monthly income from farming activities is 19,500 som (KGS). Dinara applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy cows to increase her herd. Dinara intends to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Din. Din lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only son. Din owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products, small snacks and provides mobile payment services for his community. His community sees him as a hardworking and trustworthy guy, as well as friendly mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Din is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Din improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Din is the one who is standing in front of his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (such as electricity and water) for members of his local community

loans.name: Ronniel

texts.en:
Ronniel is 27 years old and a hardworking entrepreneur.

Together with his wife they operate a wholesale grocery store.
Ronniel learned this from his former job as a salesman. His wholesale grocery store opens from 9 a.m. till 11 pm. He also delivers goods which is preferred by his costumers, gaining him more income and more orders. Ronniel does not mind the hard labor delivering boxes of groceries, as long as it can increase his income and provide for his family and 2 helpers, who depend on him for their salary. As orders grew and as much as he wanted to accommodate the extra orders, he lacked the capital to buy more products.

Ronniel is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy 20 boxes of noodles, 10 boxes of canned goods, 6 boxes of biscuits, and 40 boxes of snack foods to fill the orders of this customers.

Ronniel wants to expand his store and add another one in the future so he can provide for his family comfortably. He also wants to add another helper from his neighborhood to provide employment in his community.

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of noodles, 10 boxes of canned goods, 6 boxes of biscuits, and 40 boxes of snack foods to fill the orders of his customers

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 52 años de edad, es soltera tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 32 y 35 años pero ellas ya tienen familia, ella vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Paulina con el afán de obtener sus ingresos  y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de tamales y paches desde hace quince años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos cultiva también café y banano.
Ahora ella ha pensado en construir un dormitorio porque es una de las necesidades primordiales para su familia, pero lamentablemente ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la construcción  por tal razón solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para la compra de cemento, arena, blocks y hierro.
Ella sueña con poder construir una casa para sus hijas para luego instalar una tienda.
texts.en: Paulina is a 52 year old woman. She is single and has a beautiful family of two children, who are 32 and 35 years old, who already have their own families. She lives in a community of Suchitepéquez. In order to earn income and support her family, Paulina has worked for fifteen years selling tamales and "paches" (potato tamales), but in order to improve her earnings, she also cultivates coffee and bananas. Now, she would like to build a bedroom, because it is one of the primary needs of her family. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to build it. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, blocks and iron. She dreams of being able to build a house for her daughters, and later install a store there.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as black pepper, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase powdered soap

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. His business goal is to own a big charcoal store within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, rice, bread, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area favorable for the business and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, rice, flour and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the welfare of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more chickens. She hopes that in the future, she will have a prosperous business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as "active". She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to resell. She hopes that in the future she will have a business stall. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sufurias (cooking pots)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Ana Isabel se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza(joyas, talcos, perfumes, entre otros), con más de 6 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería(talcos, perfumes,etc.), dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad de productos, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella piensa incrementar su negocio para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel is 39 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in a rural zone of the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The community works basically in agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce.

Ana Isabel sells cosmetics and beauty products (jewelry, powders, and perfumes, among other items). She has more than 6 years of experience in this business, which is located in her home. She is applying for a loan to purchase merchandise (powders, perfumes, etc.). This investment will serve her to have a greater diversity of products, which will have a great influence on the business. She is thinking of expanding her business to be able to serve the various needs and tastes of the customers from the area, which will allow her in the short term to improve her income and increase her earnings and, as a result, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (powders, perfumes, etc.)

loans.name: Sartono

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Sartono. He lives in North Bogor, located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Sartono lives there with his wife and his children. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he heard that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. This is the second time Sartono asked a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community and he thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

As the business continue to grow, Sartono needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Sartono’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community selling Ruma’s latest product, Mapan. As seen in the photo, Sartono is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace unos años cuando tomo clases en confección; hoy en día, a sus 48 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directo; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de acolchados y cojines; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina fileteadora, así podrá ofrecer un empleo, cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Maria sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Maria is a dedicated and hardworking small business owner. Her work is in proving tailoring services.

It all started a few years ago when she took tailoring classes. Today, at age 48, she already has her own workshop with one employee. She works every day and her strength is making quilts and cushions. Her work generates sufficient funds to support her husband with the household expenses.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of a sewing machine, which will create employment, meet the customer requirements, and deliver orders in a timely manner. Ultimately, she will increase production and acquire new contracts, which will enable her to continue her business.

Maria hopes to further strengthen her workshop and to increase production. This will generate new employment opportunities and greatly improve the quality of life for her family and people that influence her work every day.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to improve her workshop

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana es una joven emprendedora, que desde hace 2 años es dueña de una pequeña distribuidora de productos para el hogar. Su único apoyo es su esposo. Ella solicita el crédito ya que desea fortalecer su negocio y ampliarlo más mediante la compra de productos como: arroz, jugos, panes, carnes, etc. esto le ayudará a tener mayores y mejores ingresos. Sus metas son hacer crecer su negocio y prosperar.
texts.en: Ana is a young entrepreneur. She has been the owner of a small home products distribution business for 2 years. Her husband is the only one who helps her. She is asking for the loan because she wants to fortify her business and expand it by buying products such as rice, juices, breads, meats, etc. This will help her to have more and better income. Her goal is to grow her business and prosper.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, juices, breads, meats, etc.

loans.name: Yeini Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Yeini es una mujer muy emprendedora, y con el ánimo de apoyar a su esposo en la consolidación de su negocio, decidió solicitar un apoyo económico para comprar herramienta y maquinaria para el taller de mecánica de motos que comparte con su conyugue.

Este es un negocio aprendido por Yeini a través de su esposo, y es por esto que busca el gran acompañamiento de Interactuar y de los prestadores de KIVA. 

Es una mujer muy trabajadora y honrada que conoce el significado que tienen las motocicletas para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.
texts.en:
Yeini is an enterprising woman. Eager to help her husband with the business, she decided to ask for financial help to buy tools and machinery for the mechanic shop that she shares with her spouse.

Yeini has learned this business through her husband and that is why she is seeking support from Interactuar and the Kiva lenders. She is a very hardworking and honest woman who knows how meaningful motorcycles are to their owners. That is why she always tries to offer excellent service, good quality and an efficient manner.

loans.use: to buy tools and machinery for the mechanic shop she shares with her spouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tool box to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria auxiliadora está en su ciclo Nª1 todas trabajan es un grupo muy responsable todas se ayudan para salir adelante son muy unidas. Con todas se está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Bernarda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela y que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir creciendo y luchando cada día. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The group named Maria Auxiliadora is in its 1rst cycle. They all work and it is a very responsible group. They all help each other get ahead and they are very close. They are all doing the poverty elimination survey so that they can grow and get ahead.  

Bernarda is one of the members of this group. She sells clothes. She says that she has a very good clientele and they always order a lot from her. She is a very hardworking woman and above all she is enterprising. 

She is asking for this loan to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants and more. This way, she can keep growing and fighting every day. She is thankful for this opportunity she is receiving so she can keep growing and be someone in life.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants and more.

loans.name: Guadalupe Dionicio

texts.es: Guadalupe Dionicio, es un hombre de 55 años de edad, acompañado. Orgullosamente se hace cargo de dos pequeños negocios, una pulpería de ventas abarrotes y es agricultor de diversos productos. Ha sido un ejemplo  a seguir para muchos ya que se ha mantenido en el mercado por 16 años. Trabaja con ADIM, desde hace 6 años, demostrando ser responsable y cumplido. Nuevamente solicita préstamo para surtir la pulpería con la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico y pollo, y una parte de para la siembra y cosecha de frijoles y maíz. Permitiéndole obtener ganancias y así alcanzar unas de sus metas, la compra de una camioneta para transportar su mercadería.
texts.en: Guadalupe Dionicio is a 55-year-old married man. He is proudly in charge of two small businesses- he owns a grocery store and farms many different products. He has been an example to follow for many because he has sold in the market for 16 years. He has been working with ADIM for 6 years, demonstrating that he is responsible and accomplishment. He again applies for a loan to supply the grocery store by buying rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, chicken, and items for the cultivation of bean and corn crops. This will permit him to obtain profits and in this way reach one of his goals, to buy a truck to transport his goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken and a variety of sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras son de la ciudad de Luque, el grupo de mujeres está integrado por 23 personas todas ellas mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ir creciendo y mejorando por medio del programa de comité de mujeres.
Todas y cada una de ellas es muy sacrificada, pero se destaca la Sra. Maria, quien tiene una humilde despensita que pudo ir formando con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a su incansable trabajo. Ella comenta que tiene ya una muy buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio, pues tiene todo tipo de productos, y quiere seguir teniendo siempre de todo para sus clientes.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas y otros, de manera a poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad de productos para sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Emprendedoras is from the city of Luque. The group of women is made up of 23 people, all of whom are female heads of household that want to grow and better themselves through the committee's program.

Each and every one of the women has sacrificed, but especially Maria, who has a humble store that was formed through much effort and thanks to her tireless work. She states that she now has many good customers who always come to her business because she has all types of products, and she wants to continue having everything for her customers. 

Maria asks for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks and other items, to be able to continue offering a good variety of products for her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received and to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks and other items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced food to fatten them.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el ditrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old, co-habitating and has one son. She lives with her family in the Oyotun district in a rural area where residents earn a living mostly through agriculture and raising livestock. It's located in the Chiclayo province and Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She earns a living selling groceries like milk, oil, rice, sugar and soda, etc. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business, which is located in her own house.

She's seeking the loan to buy more merchandise and improve her business' stock. This investment will allow her to have a better stock of products to serve the diverse needs, requirements and taste of customers in the area. This will earn her better income, allowing her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a retail business where he sells maize. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of milk. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
Maria tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de alquiler de 02 mototaxis las cuales trabajan en la zona de Cayalti y comunidades cercanas, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio. El credito será utlizado en realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a sus vehículos ya que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado, de esta manera Maria espera brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and lives with her husband in a rural area. Life there is calm and the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising animals. She's located in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

She earns a living renting two mototaxis which work in the Cayalti zone and neighboring communities. She counts on her experience in this business.

The loan will be used to make repairs and do maintenance on her vehicles, which are in bad shape. Thus, Maria hopes to provide a better service to passenger which will earn her a better income, improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs and do maintenance on her vehicles, which are in bad shape.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is 30 years old and is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one son, and her husband has been running a scrap recycling business.

Ghazala's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it, but due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk.

Therefore, Ghazala has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to enable her husband to increase his scrap business

loans.name: Nasibahon

texts.ru: Насибахон, 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Насибахон- среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи Насибахон занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду Насибахон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 коров, 50 овец. Также выращивает овощи на полях и в парнике. Хозяйство развито, поэтому ежемесячный доход составляет около 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насибахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений, клеенки для парника. Доходы от кредита Насибахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Nasibahon is 23 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising three children. Nasibahon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Nasibahon practices livestock breeding. She started this business 5 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle. Thanks to Nasibahon's hard work, she currently has 8 cows and 50 sheep on her farm. She also grows vegetables in the fields and in a greenhouse. Her farm is well developed which is why her average monthly income is 35,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Nasibahon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 150,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic covering for her greenhouse. Nasibahon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and plastic covering for her greenhouse in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, pollos, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio y en el mercado, se dedica desde hace más de 05 años a este negocio por lo que cuenta con experiencia y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Karina espera hacer crecer más su negocio lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Karina is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her partner in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock that is located in the district of Zaña, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She makes a living raising and selling young animals such as hens, chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. Her business is located in her home and in the market. She has worked in this activity for more than 5 years and has obtained good experience and references from her neighborhoods. Her loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals and feed to grow the animals. With this Karina hopes to grow her business which will allow her to better her earnings so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals and feed to grow them

loans.name: Maria Tita

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 44 años de edad, viudad, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 18 años y su negocio es la venta de maní salado.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur, área caracterizada por las características de sus suelos, que son de arenas finas y arenas limosas, de clima cálido subtropical, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo hasta la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su Vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela pública, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de maní salado, el proceso que sigue comienza; Poniendo el maní crudo dentro de un recipiente con agua caliente hasta ablandar y lograr sacar la cáscara, y lo seca dentro de un precalentado, Luego lo fríe y lo espolvorea con abundante sal fina. “aprendí este oficio de mi esposo, trabajo sola y deseo vender por mayor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con pedidos por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de maní, ella dese realizar la compra de maní por mayor para aumentar su producción y vender por mayor a clientes constantes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de maní por mayor para ampliar su negocio y vender por mayor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of 44 years of age. She is a widow and has two children, ages 12 and 18. Her business is selling salted peanuts.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, persevering, responsible, and hard-working. She carries out her business in the southern zone, an area characterized by its lands, which are of fine and muddy sands, and its warm subtropical climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long, shoulder-length black hair, short stature, and a robust build. Her maternal language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for the business that she does. She shares her life with her children, who attend the public school. They live in a rented house made of brick and cement with a tile roof. It has potable water, electrical energy, and sewer service. 

Her business is selling salted peanuts. The process follows. It begins with putting the raw peanuts in a container with boiling water until they soften and it is possible to remove the shells. Then she dries them inside a preheated [oven]. Then she fries them and sprinkles them with plenty of fine salt. "I learned this work from my husband. I work alone and I want to sell wholesale . . . ," she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has wholesale orders. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase ingredients wholesale. Her dream is to open a peanut shop. She wants to make the purchase of peanuts wholesale in order to increase her production and sell wholesale to regular customers. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the year that she has been working in this business independently.

It is for these reasons that Maria is applying for a loan to buy peanuts wholesale to expand her business and sell to her customers wholesale.

loans.use: to buy peanuts wholesale in order to expand her business and sell wholesale to her customers.

loans.name: La Paz Centro Group

texts.es:
Es  grupo mixto, llamado “La Paz Centro” conformado de 3 mujeres emprendedoras y un varón emprendedor, dueños de negocios y trabajando cada día  para sacar adelante a sus familias. Coordinado Anielca, de 38 años, casada y madre de cuatros hijos. Dedicada a la preparación y venta de nacatamales, tortillas, tamales y también a la compra y venta de cosechas de tamarindo, inicio su negocio con préstamos de otras financieras. Solicita el préstamo para poder remodelar su casa, y comprar piedras y bloques, así ampliar su hogar.
Sus otros miembros, Martha Lorena, 47 años, su negocio consiste en la preparación y venta de enchiladas, tortillas, güirila, tamales, todo esto lo comercializaba en su hogar; Johana Fabiola, 30 años, prepara y vende güirila, yoltamales, elote en el mercado local de granada; Wilber Ernesto, 32 años se dedica a la agricultura donde cosecha y vende yuca, pipián, ayote y más.
texts.en:
This is a mixed group named "La Paz Centro" (Peace Center), make up of three entrepreneurial women and one man. They are business owners and work every day to bring up their families.

Anielca, the organizer, is 38 and married with four children. She earns a living making and selling nacatamales, tortillas, tamales and also selling tamarind crops. She started her business with loans from other lenders.

She's seeking a loan to be able to remodel her house and buy stones and blocks, thus growing her home.

The other members are:

-Martha Lorena, 47, whose business involves making enchiladas, tortillas, white corn tortillas, tamales and selling this all from her home.
-Johana Fabiola, 30, who makes and sells white corn tortillas, tamales and corn in the local farmers market.
-Wilber Ernesto, 32, who earns a living through agriculture growing and selling yuca, a traditional salsa, squash and more.

loans.use: to remodel her house and buy stones and blocks, growing her home.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is a married man. He and his wife have three children.

He operates a retail business, where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals.

He is seeking this loan in the amount of 25,000 KES to buy additional fish. His business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing additional fish

loans.name: Zacarias Teofilo

texts.es:
Zacarias tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en una comunidad tranquila donde la gente se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar arreglos del lugar donde cría a sus animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Zacarias espera mejorar su negocio lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida mejorará.
texts.en:
Zacarias is 65 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his spouse in a quiet community where people make a living from commerce, raising livestock and agriculture. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo and the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living raising and selling young animals like pigs, ducks, and guinea pigs, among others. His business is located in his home. He has worked in this business for more than 10 years and in this way has obtained experience and a good reputation in his district. He will use the loan to carry out repairs in the area where he raises his animals as well as to buy feed to grow the animals. With this, Zacharias hopes to better his business, which will permit him to increase his earnings and in this way improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the area where he raises his animals and to buy feed to grow them

loans.name: Melanio

texts.es:
Melanio tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos y su cónyuge en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad pequeña cuyas actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura, ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con una finca de café, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 20 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola, cuenta con experiencia en su negocio y con muy buenas referencia personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera lograr una mejor producción, de esta manera incrementará su nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Melanio is 54 years old. He has a common law partner and has 3 dependent children. He lives with his children and his partner in the district of Cañaris, , a small community whose main activities are commerce and agriculture. It is located in the province of Ferreñafe, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru.

He works in agriculture, and has a coffee farm. He has been working in this activity for over 20 years. In addition he works as a farm worker. He has experience in this business, and has very good personal and work references in his district. The purpose of the loan is to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop. With this, he hopes to obtain a better production, thus increasing his income level and improving the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to give maintenance to his coffee crop.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man. He and his wife have two children.

He operates a transportation business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary clients are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds.

He is seeking this loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy motorcycle spare parts for re-sale purposes. His business goal is to be a supplier of motorcycle spare parts within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing motorcycle spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She and her husband have ten children.

She operates a retail business, where she sells cereals, onions, and fish. She has been involved in this business for ten years.

She is seeking this loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to open other business outlets within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will live a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory of cereals

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is so grateful since she had an opportunity to request a loan of PHP 10,000 which she used for her food stall business. With the loan, she bought more raw ingredients for her cooked dishes. This became a way for her to increase her profits. 

To improve sales, which will surely benefit her family, she is requesting this loan of PHP 20,000 that she will utilize for her current business. In advance, she would like to say thanks for your generosity and kindness. 

In the future, Sarah dreams of having her own stall. She also aspires for her children to succeed in their lives and be able to reach their dreams. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Through the loan, she was able to increase her income and her earnings were a big help for sustaining their daily family needs. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store. Surely, having more items to sell means making a better profit. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

As she hopes to attain a better living condition someday for her family, she is indeed working hard to earn money to improve her children's education. This is basically because she believes that education is the mere foundation to progress. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Erick Jose

texts.es:
Erick es un hombre de 44 años, emprendedor y honesto, que día a día lucha por salir adelante y tener una mejor condición de vida. Él desde hace 10 años es dueño de un pequeño gimnasio y tiene una venta de sandalias. Comenzó estas ideas cuando el  gimnasio era para uso personal y después decidió invertir en otros productos.

Erick solicita el crédito ya que desea invertir en ambos negocios, dar mantenimiento a las máquinas del gimnasio y comprar más sandalias con el fin de tener mejores ingresos, asimismo, darle una mejor atención a sus clientes. Las metas de este hombre son hacer crecer su negocio y expandirse a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Erick is a 44 year old man who's entrepreneurial and honest. He strives day after day to get ahead and have a better life. 

For 10 years, he's been the owner of a small gym and sells sandals. He began these ideas when the gym was for personal use, and later decided to invest in other products.

Erick seeks a loan because he wants to invest in both business, doing maintenance work on the gym machinery and buying more sandals. 

His goal is to have better income while giving his customers better service. This man's goals are to make his business grow and expand to other locations.

loans.use: to maintain gym equipment and buy sandals.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangelina is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Evangelina has a food processing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evangelina has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Evangelina  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Susan is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell such as apples, oranges, grapes, mangos, bananas, and other fruits.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell such as apples, oranges, grapes, mangos, bananas, and other fruits

loans.name: Uktamhon

texts.ru: Уктамхон, 36 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Уктамхон высшее образование, 15 лет работает учителем. Также уже много лет она занимается животноводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес, на сегодняшний день, благодаря упорству и целеустремленности в хозяйстве имеется 25 овец и 25 коз. Ежесячный совокупный доход составляет порядка 15,000 сом (KGS). Уктамхон хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота, в связи с этим она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства он приобретет скот для разведения. На доходы от кредита Уктамхон хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем приобрести мебель для дома.
texts.en:
Uktamhon is 36 years old, married and the mother of three. Uktamhon has a college degree. She has been working as a school teacher for 15 years. In addition, she has been also raising livestock for man years. She has managed to keep developing her business successfully; thanks to Uktamhon's hard work and dedication, she now has 25 sheep and 25 goats on her farm. Her total monthly revenue is approximately 15,000 KGS. 

Uktamhon would like to keep increasing her livestock headcount, which is why she applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 150,00 KGS. [She] will use these funds to buy additional livestock. Uktamhon would like to use the revenues from her loan for a further livestock increase and also to buy new furniture for her home in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her headcount.

loans.name: Abdou's Group

texts.fr: Abdou bintou qui se trouve sur la photo, assit au premier rang à l'extrême gauche,elle porte un foulard rose, est membre d’un groupe de 5 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Dialakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Abdou bintou, âgée de 37 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 14ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Abdou bintou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30ans. Abdou bintou cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Abdou bintou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement  et des semences de qualité . Cette année Abdou bintou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro des semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0,25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30ans que Abdou bintou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marchéet aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Abdou bintou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Abdou bin espère aussi pouvoir faire du commerce.
texts.en:
Abdou Bintou, appearing in the photo sitting in the first row at the far left and wearing a pink scarf, is a member of a group of five farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Dialakoro, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, aged 6 to 14, of whom three are currently in school. 

Abdou Bintou is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she was encouraged to do this work for 30 years. She grows peanuts on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and of quality seeds. 

Abdou Bintou is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality seeds. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her 0.25 hectare parcel of land. She has been growing peanuts for 30 years for their commercial value, since peanuts are a food sold on the market for their productive and bargaining advantages. 

With greater yields and higher income, Abdou Bintou is planning on buying farm supplies and equipment. Ultimately, she hopes also to be able to work in commerce.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 39-year-old divorced, caring mother of one daughter, and as most mothers she is always searching continuously for a way to provide her children with the basic needs and a good educate with fighting hard circumstances. 

Aisha is conservative woman and asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. Her daughter who appears in the photo is a student in the university majoring in physics. 

Aisha is dreaming about the day that will see her daughter graduate, but she is facing financial problems. Therefore Aisha is applying for educational loan to help her daughter pay her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.use: To help her daughter pay her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.name: Fousseyni's Group

texts.fr: Fousseyni, debout à gauche sur la photo et portant un tshirt blanc, est membre d’un groupe de 7 producteurs agricoles, qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de  N’Tena , au Sud-est du Bamako. Fousseyni, qui est âgé de 28 ans et est père 4 enfants dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille. Il a décidé de s’inscrire à myAgro dans la perspective d’augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro.Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Fousseyni a acheté un paquet  de semences hybrides et d’engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champ de 0.5 hectare. Avec cet achat, Fousseyni espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements et revenus afin que l’autosuffisance alimentaire règne dans sa famille et doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de bœufs et de matériels agricoles. Enfin, Fousseyni souhaiterait que tout le village ait de la prospérité.
texts.en:
Fousseyni, standing at the left in the photo and wearing a white T-shirt, is a member of a group of seven agricultural producers, who work and live in the village of N’Tena, in the southeast of Bamako. He is 28 years old and the father of four children, of whom two are currently in school. 

Farming enables him to ensure his entire family is self-sufficient in food. He decided to sign up with myAgro with the aim of increasing his yields through the services offered by myAgro. 

For his first year with myAgro, Fousseyni purchased a packet of hybrid seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn in his 0.5 hectare field. With this purchase, he hopes to be able to increase his yields and his revenues, so that his family is self-sufficiency in food throughout. As a farmer, he must cope with difficulties such as a lack of rain, oxen, and farm supplies. Ultimately, Fousseyni would like his entire village to be prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of hybrid seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Susanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Susanti. Susanti lives in West Bogor, located in Central Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Susanti is a young lady who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. She sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she had heard that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as a kind and trusted mobile provider.  

As the business grows, Susanti needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Susanti’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to provide an e-commerce service to her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Susanti is the one who is smiling. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Munojothon

texts.en:
Munojothon is a skillful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in the small city of Isfara. 

The appearance of modern Isfara and its adjacent areas is formed of endless blossoming gardens, deep canyons, desert landscapes, parks, narrow streets and low houses built in the traditional Oriental style. 

Munojot is one of its residents and loves to live in the fresh nature area. She is divorced and has two children. She has liked to sew since her childhood. She has many years experience sewing traditional women's dresses. 

She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders for a loan to buy textiles and necessary items to start her business serving women with traditional clothes. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy textiles and necessary items to start her business serving women with traditional clothes

loans.name: Amadou Bocar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou Bocar, s’active depuis plus de 10 ans, dans le domaine de l’élevage. Il possède une parcelle de terrain qui fait office d’enclos pour bœufs et moutons et aussi de poulailler. Il en est à son quatrième crédit à l’IMCEC ; ce dernier lui permettra d’acheter cinq moutons et un bœuf, mais aussi l’aliment bétail pour les engraisser et aussi l’aliment volaille pour les 50 poussins qui on déjà une quinzaine de jours. Amadou Bocar travaille avec un de ses frères qui gère le poulailler, ce qui fait que lui peut s’occuper des bœufs et des moutons. Il est actif toute la journée, de 8h jusqu’à 20h du soir. Amadou Bocar possède une clientèle variée à travers les marchés hebdomadaires qu’il ne rate pas puisque c’est là qu’il peut vendre des bêtes , mais aussi acheter à bon prix.
Il est marié et père de famille, qui s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et du payement des factures de son foyer.
Il  a comme ambition d’exploiter ses terres en y faisant du maraichage.
texts.en:
Mr. Amadou Bocar has been active for ten years in the domain of livestock farming. He owns a parcel of land, where there is a corral for cattle and sheep and also a chicken coop. He is on his 4th loan with IMCEC enabling him to purchase five sheep and a steer, as well as some feed for fattening them, and some chicken feed for fifty chicks, which are already about two weeks old. 

Amadou Bocar works with his brothers who manage the chicken coop, so that he can take care of the cattle and sheep. He is active all day long, from 8 AM till 8 PM. He has various customers among the weekly markets whom he does not ignore, since they are the ones who buy his animals and at a good price too. 

He is married and the father of a family, and he takes care of the day-to-day expenses and the bills for his household. His ambition is to make use of his land by operating a market-garden.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep, a steer, and some feed for fattening and then resale

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 23-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. Majed appears in the photo. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Majed would like to improve his living conditions so he decided to start a new business. 

Majed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it. By taking this loan, Majed will be able to work more hours and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it.

loans.name: April

texts.en: April is 19 years old and from Llanera, Nueva Ecija. Because of life’s hardships, she is eager to finish schooling and give her parents a better life. With that, she wants to seek financial assistance of PHP 15,000 from the Kiva lenders. She will utilize this in her school expenses. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan to help sustain her schooling.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 34 years old and has one child. Cresilda is married now.

Cresilda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cresilda has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cresilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and married with one child. With one child still in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, etc.

Rosemarie has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Emmylou

texts.en:
Emmylou is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emmylou is 30 years old now.

Emmylou has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Emmylou has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emmylou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Duhuzurukundo Group

texts.fr:
Léopold  fait partie du groupe  Duhuzurukundo et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 52 ans et est marié à Concilie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 6 à 22 ans, dont  5 étudient.

Il fait le commerce d'habits   depuis  4 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d'habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
