Léopold is part of the group Duhuzurukundo and lives in  Bujumbura. He is 52 years old and married to Concilie, a merchant. Together they have eight children, aged 6 to 22 years old, of whom five are students. 

Léopold has been doing commerce in clothing for four years. 

He is on his 1st Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of clothing to resell, so as to earn more.

In the years to come, he would like to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Yolanis

texts.es:
Yolanis es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con su hija en una humilde finca en zona rural de Ciénaga De Oro. Ella es madre soltera y durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a su hija por sus propios medios.

Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Ella sueña con ver a su hija como profesional y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Yolanis is a farm woman with drive and perseverance. She lives with her daughter on a simple farm in the rural area of Ciénaga de Oro. She is a single mother, and during all this time she has had the bravery and courage to raise her daughter on her own.

She earns a living from the raising and production of pigs to fatten. She has been in this business for two years with the goal of obtaining sufficient resources for the support of her family.

She works every day, since her pigs need constant cleaning, feeding, and monitoring for their correct development and later sale.

She is applying for the loan to purchase pigs, concentrate, and food for her animals, giving her the opportunity to have better fed litters in better conditions for purchase.

She dreams of seeing her daughter as a professional and with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrate, and food for her animals.

loans.name: Lejani

texts.en:
Lejani is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lejani is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Lejani has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for other maintenance for her business.

Lejani has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lejani would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for other maintenance for her business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 47 years old and married with five children.

Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, bread, soft drinks, and other personal care products.

Divina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Divina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, bread, soft drinks, and other personal care products

loans.name: Nilo Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 60 años, el señor Nilo luego de quedarse sin empleo, inicio a trabajar en un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras que inicio con mucha necesidad en el municipio de Lorica, desde entonces presta su servicio con algunas lavadoras que alberga en su casa y las transporta hasta el sitio del servicio.

Debido a un incidente que sufrió meses atrás se encuentra con poco capital de trabajo, es por esto que tiene la esperanza de comprar una lavadora mas para aumentar su capacidad de servicio para recuperar un poco su negocio, el cual le brinda los ingresos mínimos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en: At 60 years old and after Nilo lost his job, he started a washing machine rental business. He eagerly started this in the municipality of Lorica. Since then, he has been servicing his business with some washing machines, which he stores at home and takes them to the service location. Due to an accident suffered months ago, he has little work capital. Thus, he has the hope of buying one more washing machine to increase his service capacity to regain some of his business, which brings minimal income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy one more washing machine to increase his service capacity.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai, a capable man, was born in the northern part of Jordan in 1991. Single and living with his parents in a small village, he is a university student majoring in business administration, and is well known among his friends and students. He works as a private teacher to secure his daily pocket money, and to help his father with the household expenses.  

Odai lacks sufficient funds to pay his tuition fees. He is an ambitious guy, so he did not want to stand up without doing anything, therefore he requested a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is 54 years old lives in Baqaa. She is a mother of two children, and she is a conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Tamam is a woman who likes working to get ahead. She is working in a bank and her husband is retired from his work and now he has a small grocery store beside his house, where he sells staple goods, soft drinks, and ice cream, among other products. 

Tamam works every day from 8:00 A.M. until 3:30 P.M. in the bank, and then she helps her husband in his business. Although the business of her husband is not very big, it helps them very much, and they have been able to go on improving it. 

Tamam`s husband decided to develop his work, so Tamam like most wives wants to provide anything to help her husband. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her husband to buy more products to sell and expand his work, and that will help them to improve the standard of living for them.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell and expand his work, and that will help to improve the standard of living for them.

loans.name: Encep

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Encep. Encep lives in West Bogor, located about two hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Encep is a young guy who has big spirit to learn about how to start up a business. He knew Ruma from one of Ruma’s sales executives that came to his house. His community sees him as a friendly, hardworking, and kind mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Encep needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. 

Encep’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Encep is the one who is standing. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Amitié 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Amitié2 a soldé son premier prêt kiva sans difficulté et a procédé au renouvellement. Le membre représentatif du groupe passé avait pu acheter des draps pour revendre et à fait un bénéfice qui lui a permis de renforcer son activité. Tout le groupe remercie kiva pour son soutien. Pour le renouvellement, l'ancienne responsable n'a plus fait partie car, elle a effectué un voyage en Europe. Le nouveau membre représentatif c'est Clarisse qui est femme battante, marié et mère de 5 enfants. Cette brave dame fait le commerce de pagne et cela depuis 10 ans. Elle voudrait ce crédit pour se ravitailler pour revendre à ses clients. A l'issue de ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra d'aider dans les dépenses familiale tout en continuant son activité
texts.en:
The Amitié-2 [Frienship-2] group has repaid its first Kiva loan without issues and is taking out a new loan. The group representative has been able to buy linens for resale and earn a revenue allowing her to bolster her business. The entire group thanks Kiva for its support.

As to this new loan cycle, the previous group representative is not participating  because she is currently in Europe. The new representative's name is Clarisse. She is a resilient woman, married and the mother of five. This hard-working person has been selling traditional colorful "pagnes" fabric for 10 years. She is seeking this loan to restock her wares for resale. After completing her sale, she will earn a revenue allowing her to contribute to the household expenses while continuing her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric for resale.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à droite, et qui tient la carte myAgro près de la femme du bout, est membre d’un groupe de 19agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Momissala au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Fatoumata, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 7 à 17ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Fatoumata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20ans. Fatoumata cultive l'arachide, le riz, le sésame sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de semences de qualité  et de matériels agricoles. Fatoumata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Fatoumata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10ans que Fatoumata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Fatoumata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et  du commerce. Enfin ,Fatoumata espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille. L'Agent de terrain est présent sur la photo.
texts.en:
Fatoumata, appearing in the photo in the second row at the right and holding a myAgro card near the woman on the end, is a member of a group of nineteen farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Momissala, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 45 years old and the mother of five children, aged 7 to 17, of whom three are currently in school. 

Fatoumata is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she was encouraged to do this work for 20 years. She grows peanuts, rice, and sesame on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of quality seeds and farm supplies. 

Fatoumata is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the possibility of increasing her yields through the services offered by myAgro. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her 0.25 hectare parcel of land. She has been growing peanuts for 10 years for their commercial value, since peanuts are a food sold on the market.

With greater yields and higher income, Fatoumata is planning on raising livestock and working in commerce. Ultimately, she hopes also to be able to build a house for her family. The Land Representative is present in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sina, 38, is a married mother of five children, and three of them are in school, living in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 18 years. To earn more income, she also works for another farm for a fee. She could earn about 75,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund for five cycles already and has fully paid back her loans. Now she is leading a group of two applying for this loan, and would use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming. Through this loan, she hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the school fees of her four children

loans.name: Soledad Reyes

texts.es: Soledad de 60 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad. Ella junto a su grupo familiar cuentan con un pequeño taller en el cual elaboran camas de madera y junco, además tiene una pequeña tienda de productos varios lo que le permite sostener la economía del hogar. Soledad siempre buscando brindar lo mejor a su familia ha decidido construir un cuarto para el baño,  ya que actualmente no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para ello, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto para el baño y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales. Ella se acerca nuevamente a FUSAI ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual le permitió construir su vivienda de madera por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Soledad, who is 60 years of age, is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband and their two children, ages 22 and 18. She and her family group have a little workshop in which they make beds of wood and rush. In addition, she has a little shop with various products that allows her to support the household economy. 

Soledad is always seeking to offer the best to her family. She has decided to build a room for the bath, since now she doesn't have a suitable place for it. For this reason she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room for the bath and in this way improve their dwelling conditions. 

She has approached FUSAI again because in the past she applied for a loan that allowed her to build her house of wood, for which she feels very grateful.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room for the bath in her home

loans.name: Kamarhon

texts.en:
Kamarhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan. She lives in the town which is surrounded by majestic mountains and beautiful landscapes. She is a widow and has four children. 

After her husband's death, she was obligated to feed her family herself.  She does a business of buying and selling seeds of fruits like apricot, almond, pistachio, etc. Her business does not give her enough money to feed her family. 

She appealed to IMON and KIVA lenders asking financial support to start a new business and buy a varied assortment of seeds. She hopes to be supported and earn enough money from her business to feed her family. She wishes to have permanent clients.

loans.use: to start a new business and buy a varied assortment of seeds

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells auto spare parts. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are vehicle owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts. Her business goal is to be the best seller of spare parts within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells juices, sodas and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 99,000 loan to buy more stock of juices, soda, and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of juices, soda, and other items

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a vehicle within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a quality life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Flotelia

texts.en:
Flotelia is 45 years old and has five children. Flotelia is married and has three children who are in school.

Flotelia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Flotelia has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flotelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory works hard to support her family. Glory is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Glory requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, meat, flour, spices, and other utensils needed for her business.

Glory has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, meat, flour, spices, and other utensils needed for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 62-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maria has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maria has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is 60 years old, married with four children.

Sanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, bread, soft-drinks and other personal care products.

Sanita has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Sanita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, bread, soft-drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old and married with five children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, etc.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from E-Loading.

Virginia aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
Avetik is a farmer, skilled and experienced, who lives with his sons and their families in the village Lchashen of the Gegharkunik region. 

His farm is a cute one; here he has calves and pigs. He sells a small amount of meat from his farm and also he gathers hay from his land again for sale. From the village there are several farmers who constantly buy hay from Avetik as a fodder for their farm cattle. 

As Avetik says, since his hay mowing machine became out of order, his family income has been greatly reduced and he is greatly worried about it. He greatly needs this loan in order to buy a new hay mowing machine that will work quickly and with great income for his big family.

loans.use: to buy a new hay mowing machine that will work quickly

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate used the previous loan to buy fresh foods to sell. She is still in the same business and at the same time does farming that gives her more income. 

She is facing challenges of price fluctuation that hinder progress of her business. Kate has hopes of establishing a grocery business. She needs a loan to help her buy fresh foods  like potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods  like potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

Merlinda has a business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food processing.  Merlinda is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of beverages to sell in her beverages business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beverages to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cicilia works hard to support her family.

Cicilia has a business buying and selling shoes in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Cicilia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of shoes and slippers to sell in her business.

Cicilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Saraswati. Saraswati lives in North Bogor, a suburban area located around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Saraswati is a young lady who has a big desire to become an entrepreneur. She owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as a kind and trusted mobile provider.  

As the business grows, Saraswati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Saraswati’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Saraswati is the one who is sitting in front of her stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 69 años de edad, y es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega. Cuenta con una pequeña parcela de café de 4.55 hectáreas, la cual ha logrado certificar con comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E Practices. Para él y su familia, la actividad de café es la principal fuente de ingresos.

Para este año, Porfirio está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere para asegurar una buena cosecha, la cual proyecta sea de unos 90 quintales de café pergamino.

Este pequeño productor confía en que este rubro es rentable y que la inestabilidad del mercado se puede enfrentar con los precios mínimos que ofrece el mercado Fairtrade, por lo que su objetivo es incrementar su producción, y con ellos sus ingresos a fin de ir aumentando el área de su pequeña finca, y con ello mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 69 years old and is a small coffee producer in a community of Jinotega. He has a small coffee plot of 4.55 hectares, which he has gotten to certify with fair trade, UTZ, and C.A.F.E. Practices. For him and his family, the coffee business in the main source of income.

For this year, Porfirio is requesting a loan that allows him to ensure the purchase of inputs and fertilizers that he needs to ensure a good harvest, which he plans will be of about 90 quintals of parchment coffee.

This small producer trusts that this field is profitable and that the instability of the market can be confronted with the minimum prices that the Fairtrade market offers, which is why his objective is to raise his production and, with them, his income in order to increase the area of his small farm and, with it, improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizers that will allow him to improve his coffee crop.

loans.name: Sithun's Group

texts.en:
Sithun, 33, is a married mother of three dependent children, and two of them are in school, living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. 

The sources of her family’s income are from potato farming and working for other farms for a fee. She has been involved in this business for twelve years, and it earns her about 39,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), while for the other one it is the first loan. The previous loan helps her to have a better living condition. 

Now she is leading this group to take the loan portion to buy farming supplies for  the farm. She hopes that she could earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Elsa Margot

texts.es:
Elsa ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por su hijo ya que es separada; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a preparar y vender queso de leche de vaca desde hace 3 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su hijo que es mayor de edad y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja con 3 familiares en su negocio incluyendo a su hijo todos los días y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar tanques que le permitan almacenar la leche que compra para la preparación de sus quesos. 

Elsa manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a su hijo, para verlo convertirse en profesional y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Elsa has been a very dedicated housewife, always alert to the care of her family, which consists of her son, since she is separated. She has always liked to work as an independent businessperson. She began to prepare and sell cows' milk cheese three years ago, since she is responsible for the economic burden of her household along with her son, who is an adult, and so she needs to generate the income to do it.

Her customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends from the district. She works with three relatives in her business, including her son. She works every day and in her work has the advantage of being able to look after her family at the same time that she manages to be productive as a businessperson.

She is now applying for the loan to buy tanks that will allow her to store the milk that she buys for the preparation of her cheeses.

Elsa states that her great desire is to be able to continue supporting her family economically and give her son an education in order to see him become a professional and have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy tanks that will allow her to store the milk that she buys for the preparation of her cheeses.

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en: Sothea, 33, is a married mother of one child, living in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. The source of her family’s income for the past five years is from potato farming, and working for other farmers provides an additional source of her income. She earns about 40,000 KHR per day. Sothea has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner for one cycle already and completely repaid the loan. Now she is leading a group of two to apply for this loan. She intends to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that she could earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en: Wesam is a 26-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He has an internet cafe in the city and also he repairs computers and electronic devices. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. Wesam would like to improve his business and expand it, so he requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more computers for his internet cafe. This will help him to serve more clients and increase his income. Wesam appears in the photo while working.

loans.use: to buy more computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Shifira

texts.en: Shifira is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cows and goats. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are butchery owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more livestock. She hopes that in the future, she will own land. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Merlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Merlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Merlyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, coffee, shampoo, fabric conditioner and other groceries. 

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren in the village Tsovagyugh of Gegherkunik region. This family cares for their farm very much since only through its income can they cover their family needs. 

In farming mainly Silva’s son helps her. She has cows, bulls, a pig, sheep, lambs and chickens. Silva sells at the wholesale market her farm’s milk, meat, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter, eggs, and also her land’s potatoes and greens. 

She hopes so much that with developing her farm she may earn a better living for her grandchildren and help her son’s young family to solve their financial needs. This loan of 700,000 AMD (Armenian drams) Silva will spend on the purchase of one more calf, fodder for her farm cattle,  fertilizer, and potato seedlings for her land.

loans.use: to purchase one more calf, fodder for her farm cattle, fertilizer, and potato seedlings for her land

loans.name: Kirasa Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Leonard is a 29-year-old man whose passion for agriculture led him to start up an Agro Farm Input shop in Kagadi, Uganda. He also does farming to supplement his income. 

Leonard wants a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sell. 

Leonard is a member of Kirasa Tweimukye Group whose members don't pledge security but guarantee each other to access a loan.

In future, Leonard wants to build a house and get married.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sell.

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es:
Dina es una madre separada de 22 años de edad, emprendedora y dinámica. 

Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de alimentos, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 2 años que lleva funcionando su negocio. 

El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la compra de insumos e ingredientes como pollo, harina, arroz, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer sus alimentos de una mejor manera, abriendo paso para un mejoramiento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe. 

Dina, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dina is 22-year-old energetic single mother and an entrepreneur.

In order to generate income for the household expenses, she decided to start her own business selling food. She managed to cover personal and family expenses during the 2 years of her business operation.

Loan will be used to purchase inputs and ingredients such as chicken, flour, rice etc. They will allow her to continue her work and provide the food in a better way. This will lead to improved sales and income.

Dina has the spirit of excellence and drive to achieving her objectives. Her goal is to expand her business to have the capacity to serve more customers. It will improve profitability from the facility so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and ingredients such as chicken, flour, rice etc.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 29-year-old caring mother of 3 children, and like most mothers, she is always searching for a way to provide her children with the basic necessities. She is also always looking to help her husband fight their difficult circumstances.  

Hala is talented in embroidery, which she learned from her mother-in-law. She was working at this as a means to help her husband with small amounts of income, until 2006 when she took a loan to improve her house and her small business. Day-by-day her business has been growing as she taught embroidery to her neighbors, and the work was divided amongst them. 

Now Hala is seeking to improve her business further, and we would be very pleased to help this well-respected, motivated woman have her dreams come true. 

Hala has applied for a loan to both expand and develop her services as well as buy yarn to increase her products.

loans.use: to both expand and develop her services as well as buy yarn to increase her products.

loans.name: Teobaldo Enrique

texts.es:
Teobaldo, con 29 años de edad, es un padre de 3 hijos. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de platano, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del platano en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Teobaldo solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.

Teobaldo sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
Teobaldo, who is 29 years old, is a father of three children.

He was born and raised in the country, where he learned farm work by his father’s side. Thanks to him, now he raises banana crops, whose harvest is sold so that he can earn enough to bring food home. 

The borrower is an assertive and hard-working man who is dedicated to his family and to his work. This motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead. He strives each day to overcome the obstacles that come his way. He has gone through difficult financial situations due to the low price of bananas in the market, which affects the price of his product.

Teobaldo is requesting his loan at Corporation Interactuar so he can invest it in buying farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides) so he can continue with his business and get his crops ready to produce a very high-quality product.

Teobaldo dreams of improving and increasing his crops to get a good monthly income from them.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides)

loans.name: Ivan Alberto

texts.es:
Ivan, un padre de 32 años de edad con 4 hijos a su cuidado de 6, 4, 2  años, es padre cabeza de hogar y ha podido sostener a su numerosa familia gracias a que trabaja como productor agropecuaria en su finca. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa de pollos y huevos los cuales criara y alimentara para obtener los recursos necesarios para poder vivir, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente por sus hijos porque quiere disfrutar con ellos de una mejor vida, que estudien y que todos los días tengan un motivo para sonreír. 

Apoya a este empresario que quiere demostrar que el papel de padre no le queda grande, solo necesita tu voto de confianza.
texts.en:
Ivan is a 32 years old father with 4 dependent children at the age of 6, 4 and 2. He is the head of the household and has been able to support his large family by working as agricultural producer on his farm.

He requests a loan to start his own business of a small company that involves poultry and eggs. He will raise and feed them to obtain the necessary resources to live. He is taking the initiative for his children because he wants to enjoy a better life with them. He wants them to study and to have a reason to smile every day.

Support this entrepreneur who wants to show that the role of father is not great, just need your vote of confidence.

loans.use: to buy poultry and eggs for him to raise and feed in order to obtain the necessary resources to live.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor y su esposa son personas humildes que día a día trabajan y luchan por el bienestar de sus dos hijos. Ellos viven en una casa rústica en una comunidad rural lejos de la ciudad. Sus dos hijos son menores de edad y están en la escuela. Lamentablemente uno de sus hijos se encontraba delicado de salud por problemas neurológicos y fue sometido a tratamientos y cirugías para su recuperación es por ello que el señor solicita ayuda a través de un crédito para cubrir los gastos médicos, cancelar la cuenta del centro médico donde se encuentra internado su hijo y comprar medicamentos. El y su esposa son personas responsables y trabajadoras que se dedican a la agricultura desde su juventud y con mucho amor y esfuerzo quieren sacar adelante a sus hijos y su familia.
texts.en:
The man and his wife are humble people who day after day work and fight for the well-being of their two sons. They live in a rustic house in a rural community far away from the city. Their two sons are younger in age, and they are in school. Lamentably, one of their sons has delicate health due to neurological problems, and he was submitted to treatments and surgeries for his recovery. 

That's why the man asks for help through a loan to cover the medical costs, terminate the medical center account where his son is staying and to buy medications. He and his wife are responsible and hard-working people who have made a living in agriculture since their youth, and with a lot of love and effort they want to get their sons and their family ahead.

loans.use: to cover their son's medical costs, terminate the account at the medical center where he is staying, and to buy medications

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She is living in Isfara city with her family. Many centuries ago the territory of modern Isfara was one of the key points on the Great Silk road. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a worker. 

Tahmina is an active and hardworking person. She tries to support her husband in feeding the family and keeping the household. She is talented because she has had an activity of sewing traditional women dresses since when she was schoolgirl. Now she has students who are learning from her how to sew and permanent clients every day who are satisfied by her work. She wants to open a tailoring store where she could take orders and teach her students. She is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy a sewing machine and open a new business of serving Tajik women. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and open a new business of serving Tajik women

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda, no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder pero cuenta con una hija de 44 años de edad que la acompaña en su hogar, Eugenia vive en casa propia de material rústico, es natural de la zona, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Eugenia vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Eugenia es la venta de productos de bodega, las ventas las realiza en su propio domicilio, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este rubro, además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 62 years old, a widow, she does not have a son, but she has a daughter who is 44 years old who lives with her. Eugenia lives in her own home made of rustic material. She is a native of this zone and has good personal and business references. Eugenia lives in the rural part of the district of Pucará in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Perú. 

Eugenia's business is a bodega and she runs this business out of her home. She has five years of experience in this trade. She also sells beauty products.
This loan will be to buy a larger quantity of products to increase the stock of her business. This will generate better revenue and that way she will be able to improve her earnings and for that matter her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products to increase the stock of her business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a corn farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits. Nelia is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to  buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her corn farming business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 40-year-old married woman, with three children. With two children in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Nancy has been in this business for 3 years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, coffee, oil, sugar, noodles, candies, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Kikona Tukurakurane Farmers Group

texts.en: Aloysious is a Ugandan male of 39 years living in Kagadi. He has been selling beans and maize since 2000 to generate income. He hopes to grow his business despite bad weather changes and lack of enough capital to buy stock. Aloysious is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize for selling. He is a member of Kikona Tukurakurane Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 48 years old. Rosalie is married and has two children who are still in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, growing vegetables in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalie has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 73 years old and widowed with four children. Felicisima works very hard to provide for them.

Felicisima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Felicisima has been in this business for 30 years now. 

In the future, Felicisima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Regina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Regina has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell such as soap, sugar, biscuits, soft drinks, milk, coffee, candies and other groceries. 

Regina is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 36 years old and has two children. Maricel is married and has two children who are still in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maricel has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Danet

texts.en:
Danet is a 27-year-old married woman, and is the mother of one child. She lives in Kratie province. 

The main source of Danet's family’s income is rice farming, which they have been doing for one year. Raising pigs provides additional income, and Danet can earn about 41,000 KHR per day to contribute to her family’s needs. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Danet has applied for this loan in order to buy piglets to raise for sale. She hopes that with this loan she can produce more income, as well as producing food for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Residing in Mondulkiri province, Sophy is 44 years old and a mother of three children. Two of them are in school. For her family’s living, she grows potatoes and works for other farms to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for more than five years and earns about 61,000 KHR per day on average. This is her second loan for her group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy farming supplies. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: El Volcán Group

texts.es:
Pascuala ( es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía que está tejiendo) es una mujer muy trabajadora y perseverante, que agradece por el crédito al que tuvo acceso, porque gracias a ello logro comprar hilos de distintos colores y mejoro la calidad de sus tejidos típicos, con ello mejoraron sus ingresos, pero Pascuala es una mujer muy optimista que desea seguir superándose por tal motivo ahora solicita un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá el en la compra de una variedad de colores de hilos para seguir elaborando lindos trajes típicos.
Pascuala sueña con poder construir su casa para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pascuala (farthest to the left, the one weaving) is a hard-working and persevering woman who is thankful for the loan that she has previously received. Thanks to that loan she was able to buy yarn of different colors and improve the quality of her usual products, and that improved her income. 

Pascuala is a very optimistic woman that wants to continue outperforming. For this reason she is now requesting a new loan that she will invest in the purchase of a variety of colored yarn in order to keep making beautiful traditional clothing. Pascuala dreams of one day building her house to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy yarns to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Loay

texts.en:
Loay is a 18-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. Loay would like to improve his living conditions so he decided to start a new business. 

Loay took a loan from FATEN that will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it. By taking this loan, Loay will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

Loay appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is now living in a rural area famous for beautiful long gardens and landscapes. 

Mukaddas is married. She is a hardworking, kind and punctual person. About two years she started sewing traditional women's dresses, She now has permanent clients. Her business is doing well and the money that she earns from her activity supports her family. 

She participated in a training provided by IMON and decided to start a new business serving Tajik women. She wants to enlarge her business and open a tailoring store where she could sew and take orders from clients. Mukaddas is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders and IMON to buy textiles and other necessary items for sewing. She hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy textiles and other necessary items for sewing.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 24-year-old married man, and is blessed with one child. He has been a dairy farmer for the last six years. He earns a monthly income of 13,000 KES from his business. 

Ezekiel has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to buy a dairy cow, to enable him meet the demands of his customers for milk. He hopes to use his anticipated profit to repay the loan, and to educate his children. 

Ezekiel's hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. Ahmad works transferring goods for the local traders using his old rickshaw.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old and married with two children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and other groceries.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns income from buying and selling spices.

Rosalie hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 31 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, coffee, shampoo, laundry detergent and bath soap. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Rochile

texts.en:
Rochile is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rochile is 30 years old and has five children who are all in school.

Rochile has an egg business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

Rochile has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rochile would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Winnie Fritzel

texts.en:
Winnie Fritzel is a 26-year-old married woman, with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Winnie Fritzel runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Winnie Fritzel has been in this business for one year, and sells a variety of items, such as beverages, oil, vinegar, soap, shampoo, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Winnie Fritzel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.  Violeta is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy materials to improve her shop for her vulcanizing shop business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her shop

loans.name: Jannelyn

texts.en:
Jannelyn is 45 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Jannelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jannelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Jannelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Jannelyn would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kigoto Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Godwin is a thirty-five-year-old hardworking married man with three children aged 7 years, 3 years and 2 months old. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He grows and sells produce. He also earns extra income from his monthly salary as a teacher. He is optimistic of having a big developed business, a big store for produce and educated children but has been limited by competition and weather changes.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more produce like maize to sell in the next season.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize to sell in the next season.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Living in Mondulkiri province, Yet is 46 years old and a mother of three children. Two of them are in school. 

To support her family, she grows potatoes and peppers to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for six years and earns about 97,800 KHR per day. This is the first time for Yet to work with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She will spend her loan to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
Analina is 52 years old, married with three children.

Analina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analina has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Analina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bunny's Group

texts.en:
Bunny is 43 years old and resides in the Mondulkiri province.  She is the mother of six children. Two of her children are in school. She grows potato for sale to earn her family's living. She has been involved in this business for fourteen years. 

This is the second loan for her group with VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living condition and expand her current business.

loans.use: to pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Cheth's Group

texts.en: Cheth, 46, lives with family members in a rural village of Kampong Thom province and is a mother of five children. She grows rice and works for other farms for income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a private toilet for her family’s use. She hopes that her family will have good health and better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 28 años de edad es soltero y tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 4 y 8 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Diego con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia trabaja como agricultor desde hace dos años, esta actividad para él es muy rentable.
Pero Diego ahora se ve a la necesidad de comprar un terreno de 28 X 28 varas para utilizarlo para cultivo de milpa, porque él no cuenta con terreno suficiente, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar la compra, por tal motivo solicita un crédito para poder cubrir esta necesidad que tiene el y su familia.
Diego anhelo poder construir una casa y que sus hijos puedan graduarse y ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Diego is a single 28-year-old man and has a beautiful family of two children, between the ages of 4 and 8. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá. 

Diego is eager to improve his income and take care of his family. He has worked as a farmer for two years, work which for him is very profitable.

But Diego now sees the need to buy a plot of land that is 28 x 28 varas [a unit of land measurement in Guatemala] to use to grow corn since he doesn’t have enough land to grow it, but one of his problems is that he doesn’t have enough money to be able to buy it. That is the reason he is requesting a loan to be able to cover this need that he and his family have.

Diego longs to be able to build a house and for his children to graduate and be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy land to grow corn.

loans.name: Njokerio United Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Gladys, a member of the Njokerio United Self Help Group, in Nakuru Kenya. She is fifty-nine years old, and married with 6 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March 2014.

Gladys farms maize, beans and potatoes. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits out of her farm than before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer to expand her farming business. This will improve her income and hence put her in a position to educate her children and provide for her family's needs. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer to boost farm ouput.

loans.name: Moussa's Group

texts.fr: Moussa qui se trouve sur la photo, assit au premier rang à l'extrême droite, et qui porte un T-shirt PUMA jaune, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Morodiambougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Moussa, âgé de 54 ans, est le père de 23 enfants,ils sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Moussa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 42ans. Moussa cultive le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais et de semences de qualité. Moussa entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement  et de l'avis favorable de son entourage sur l'impact positif de myAgro. Cette année Moussa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro des semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 38ans que Moussa cultive le mais pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Moussa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Moussa espère aussi pouvoir autosuffisance alimentaireainsi que mariage des enfants.
texts.en:
Moussa, who is seated on the far right of the first row in the photo wearing a yellow Puma T-shirt, is a member of a group composed of eight farmers who are members of myAgro. They work and live in the village of Morodiambougou to the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Moussa, 54 years old, is the father of 23 children, who attend school. His family has been traditionally engaged in farm work, which is the main source of income. It provides food for the household and also provides sufficient means to cover other household expenses. This is why Moussa has been working as farmer for some 42 years. 
He grows corn on his field. His challenges are low rainfall and lack of quality fertilizers and seeds. 

This is Moussa's first year with myAgro; he has signed up for a payment plan, having heard about the positive impact of myAgro in his community. This year Moussa is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro OPV [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers to increase  the yield of corn on his field of 0.5 ha [1.2 acres]. Moussa has been growing corn for 38 years because of the economic returns and market demand.  Thanks to a larger harvest and a higher revenue, Moussa hopes to expand the size of his field. He also hope to be able to provide for the family's food as well for his children's weddings.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Mwoloto Women Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photo is Agnes. She is sixty-five years old, married, and a mother of eight. She is a member of Mwoloto Women Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2012, in order to acquire skills in group management, savings mobilization, enterprise development, and financial management.

Agnes sells basic household items like utensils, stoves, and lantern lamps, and is borrowing from Kiva to buy more utensils, so she can add stock and produce more income, to buy clothing and food for her family.

Agnes is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more utensils, in order to add stock and  produce more income, to buy clothing and food for her family.

loans.name: Teodoro Nelis

texts.es: Teodoro de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su cinco hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo desde hace 35 años e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
60-year-old Teodoro lives in his own house with his wife and their five children. For the past 35 years, he has made a living by farming corn and sorghum. He started out with his own capital. He sells his products in the neighboring towns, and with the money he makes, he is able to cover some of his household costs.

He is requesting a loan to buy more seeds, manure, fertilizer, plague control, etc. so he can continue his work to make a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, manure, fertilizer, plague control, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old, married to Nancy and supports six family members. 

He has been a taxi operator for the last eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to buy a dairy cow. This will enable him to earn additional income and expand his two businesses.

With the generated profits, James will be able to repay his loan and educate his children to higher levels of study. His hope is to be financially stable and buy more vehicles for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Julia Susana

texts.es: Susana esta casada, su esposo trabaja de chofer, Susana tiene 30 años de edad y sus 2 hijos tiene 2  años y 6 años de edad, el niño de 6 años asiste  a la escuela, Susana crecio en el campo y sus padres le enseñaron como es la actividad de la crianza de ganado, Susana solicita el dinero del credito para comprar terneros y cuidarlos hasta que esten listos para comercializarlos y de ahí tener ganancia, Susana tiene en su mente mejorar su negocio y  comprarse una casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Susana is married, her husband works as a chauffeur. Susana is 30 years old and her two children are 2 and 6 years old. The six year old goes to school. Susana grew up in the country and her parents taught her the work of raising cattle. 

Susana is asking for the loan money to buy calves and raise them until they are ready to sell and from that have a profit. Susana has in her mind to improve her business and buy herself a house to improve the quality of life of her children.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Consuelo Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera. Beatriz tiene un hijo de 11 años y una hija de 16 años de edad, los 2 se encuentran estudiando, Beatriz es una madre muy responsable, trabaja desde hace 15 años atrás en el negocio de comercializacon de frutas, Beatriz solicita el dinero del credito para comprar mercaderia en frutas como naranjas, platanos, manzanas, mangos, peras , entre otrás. Beatriz esta contenta con su negocio y sus deseos son mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para tener con que cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 34-year-old single mother. Beatriz has an 11-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter. Both are in school.

Beatriz is a very responsible mother. For the past 15 years, she has made a living by selling fruit.

Beatriz is requesting the loan to buy fruit merchandise, such as oranges, bananas, apples, mangoes, pears, and other fruits. Beatriz is happy with her business, and her dreams are to improve sales and increase her income so that she will have enough money to cover her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with 8 children. He has been living in the informal settlement since he was in 4th grade. He is an opinion leader in the community and a leader in the Nyumba Kumi initiative.

John has 4 plots on which he wants to install Fresh Life Toilets. He first learned about the franchise through a friend who is an operator, and he developed an interest because he saw how hygienic the toilets were.  

John earns a living as a real estate agent, which will help him to pay for the Fresh Life Toilet. Because of his tight schedule, the toilets will be managed by his wife.

John is planning to increase the number of toilets in the near future. He is so appreciative to Fresh Life initiative for offering such a noble venture.

loans.use: to purchase one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 52 years old and is married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as beverages, shampoo, and home care products, as well as other groceries.

Zenaida has been in this business for 4 years selling a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, soft drinks, soap, diapers, biscuits, and other groceries. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, shampoo, and home care products, as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 56 years old, and a widow with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marissa has a food production business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marissa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, arroz y frijoles, tienes 10 años de experiencia en el cultivo el cual inicio con capital propio, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, Rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, agroquímicos, etc. y así poder tener una mejor cosecha y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
47-year-old Rosa is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her daughter.

She makes a living by farming corn, rice, and beans. She has 10 years of experience in farming, a business she started with her own capital. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the silos seen in the photo, and later sells it in areas near where she lives.

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, agrochemicals, etc. With these, she will be able to have a better harvest and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, agrochemicals, etc.

loans.name: Shelove

texts.fr: Shelove a 27 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait le commerce de son de blé et d’engrais dans un espace qu’elle a emménagé chez elle. Elle a beaucoup de clients. Son activité l’aide à prendre soin de sa famille. Elle veut agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Elle a fait une demande de microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de marchandises
texts.en: Shelove is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. She runs a business selling wheat and grain bran in a space that she installed in her home. She has many clients. Her business helps her to take care of her family. She wants to further increase her business and offer herself better living conditions. She made this microcredit request to be able to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase bags of grain

loans.name: Jinette

texts.fr: Ginette est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui sont scolarisés. Elle commercialise des articles de couture (boutons, zips, dentelles...) au marché de son quartier. Cela fait plus de 5 ans et cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Elle a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs microcrédits qui l’ont aidé à faire avancer son commerce. Elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus et pouvoir épargner pour les études de ses enfants. Craignant une éventuelle rupture de stock, elle demande un microcrédit afin d’augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Ginette is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of two children who are in school. She sells sewing items (buttons, zippers, lace) in the neighborhood market. It's been more than five years and the business allows her to contribute to the daily needs of her family. She has already benefited from several microloans which have helped her to advance her business. She wishes to increase her revenues and to be able to save for the children's studies. Fearing running out of stock, she is asking for a microloan in order to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of cloths for uniforms

loans.name: Acephie

texts.fr: Acephie, 59 ans, est vendeuse de Pèpè (vêtements de seconde main) depuis déjà 30ans. Veuve, elle a élevé son fils grâce aux revenus que lui procure cette petite activité commerciale. Elle souhaite continuer à faire tourner ce commerce pour garder son autonomie financière. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Acephie, 59 years old, has been a Pèpè (second-hand clothing) saleswoman for more than 30 years. A widow, she raised her son thanks to the revenues that this small commercial business procures. She wishes to continue to run her business in order to maintain her financial autonomy. She needs a microloan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothing
